It will be a match between Faf du Plessis's Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) and Sam Curran's Punjab Kings (PBKS). Right now, Royal Challengers Bengaluru is in seventh place with just 8 points from 4 wins to their tally and a net run rate of -0.049 on the IPL 2024 points table, and Punjab Kings are in eighth position with 8 points from 4 wins and a net run rate of -0.187.\n\nThe next match between Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) and Punjab Kings (PBKS) in the Indian Premier League (IPL) is crucial for both teams. RCB has improved after a bad start, winning three matches in a row and moving up in the points table. But they still need to win all their remaining games to have a chance at making it to the playoffs. Punjab Kings are in a similar situation, also needing to win to stay in the competition.\n\nThe match is important for both teams as only one can potentially reach the 14-point mark needed for the playoffs. RCB feels confident after their recent wins and a previous victory against Punjab Kings. While Punjab Kings have a slightly better record against RCB in the past, RCB won their last encounter with strong performances from Virat Kohli and Dinesh Karthik.\n\nPrediction: The match between RCB and Punjab Kings will be closely contested, with both teams giving their best to secure a win. RCB's recent form and confidence might give them a slight edge, but Punjab Kings will also fight hard to stay in the competition. It could be an exciting match with RCB having a better chance of winning.\n\nBefore their upcoming match on Thursday, May 9th, PBKS and RCB have played against each other 32 times. Punjab Kings has won slightly more matches against RCB in the IPL, winning 17 out of 32 matches compared to RCB's 15 victories. However, in their most recent clash this season, RCB won thanks to strong performances by Virat Kohli, who scored 77 runs, and Dinesh Karthik, who made 28 runs off just 10 balls.\n\nBat 1st: Virat Kohli, Will Jacks, Rajat Patidar, Faf du Plessis (c), Glenn Maxwell, Dinesh Karthik (wk), Cameron Green, Swapnil Singh, Mohammed Siraj, Vyshak Vijaykumar, Karn Sharma\n\nBowl 1st: Dinesh Karthik, Faf Du Plessis, Virat Kohli, Anuj Rawat, Will Jacks, Dinesh Karthik, Tom Curran, Glenn Maxwell, Cameron Green, Mohammed Siraj, Mayank Dagar, and Raja Patidar\n\nImpact Players Option: Faf Du Plessis, Anuj Rawat, Glenn Maxwell\n\nBat 1st: Jonny Bairstow, Prabhsimran Singh, Shashank Singh, Rilee Rossouw, Jitesh Sharma (wk), Sam Curran (c), Rahul Chahar, Ashutosh Sharma, Harpreet Brar, Kagiso Rabada, Harshal Patel.\n\nIn the upcoming match between Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) and Punjab Kings in the Indian Premier League (IPL), both teams are fighting to stay in the tournament. RCB has been doing better lately, winning three games in a row and moving up to seventh place. But they still need to win all their remaining matches to make it to the playoffs. Punjab Kings are in a similar situation, also needing to win their matches to stay in the competition.\n\nThe match between RCB and Punjab Kings is crucial because only one team can potentially reach the 14-point mark needed to advance. RCB has a bit of an edge because they won their previous match against the Punjab Kings this season.\n\nThe pitch at the HPCA Stadium, where the match will be played, has been favouring the team batting first. Spinners are expected to play an important role, so both teams may include at least two specialist spinners in their lineup. A strong batting lineup will also be important because the pitch tends to produce high scores.\n\nKey players to watch out for are Virat Kohli, who has been in great form and scored well against Punjab Kings before, Shashank Singh, who has been consistent and played important innings for Punjab Kings, and Harshal Patel, who has been taking wickets consistently and strengthening Punjab Kings' bowling attack.\n\nOut of the 12 IPL matches played at the HPCA Stadium, 58.33% of them were won by the team batting first, while the remaining 41.67% were won by the chasing team.\n\nThe HPCA Stadium in Dharamshala has hosted 12 IPL matches since March 2010. It's known for its pitches that offer good bounce, which helps fast bowlers, and also provides opportunities for batsmen to score runs. The average score in the first innings is quite high, around 179 runs. However, in the recent match between CSK and Punjab Kings, CSK scored 167 runs in their innings. Spinners played a significant role in that game, with Rahul Chahar and Ravindra Jadeja both taking three wickets each.\n\nAccording to Accuweather.com, there's a 51% chance of rainfall at 5 PM IST today. {"uri": "8119664571", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "19:05:13", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T19:05:13Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T19:04:14Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8039215803146362, "url": "https://www.crictracker.com/twitter-reactions-cricket/ipl-2024-pbks-vs-rcb-todays-match-highlights-unmissable-video-recap-turning-points/", "title": "IPL 2024: PBKS vs RCB Today's Match Highlights", "body": "On Thursday, Punjab Kings (PBKS) and Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) clashed against each other in Match 58 at Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium, Dharamsala. PBKS skipper Sam Curran won the toss and chose to bowl against RCB. Royal Challengers Bengaluru win a big one by beating PBKS by 60 runs.\n\nThis match was a must-win for both teams as the losing team would be eliminated from the tournament and unfortunately, it was the Punjab Kings. RCB players showed a class performance in the must-win game against PBKS. Virat Kohli's stunning batting performance in the first innings pulled off well for RCB to put up a target of 241 runs for PBKS.\n\nAlso Check: IPL 2024 Points Table\n\nVirat Kohli has performed like a true sportsman in this season of the Indian Premier League. In the match against Punjab Kings, Kohli pulled off a great show for the spectators at Dharamsala. He scored 92 runs off 42 balls, unfortunately, he fell short of 8 runs from scoring his second century of this season. He has scored 634 runs in 12 matches with a strike rate of 153.51 and continues to keep the Orange Cap in IPL 2024. To support Kohli, Rajat Patidar and Cameron Green scored 55 off 23 balls and 46 runs off 27 balls respectively. Virat Kohli also won the 18th Player of the Match award in IPL history.\n\nThe way Jonny Bairstow and Rilee Roussow started off to chase the score against RCB, it seemed like they were going to beat RCB. But, the RCB bowlers struck and dismissed both the openers followed by the next in their batting line-up. Mohammed Siraj, Karn Sharma, Swapnil Singh and Lockie Ferguson restricted Punjab Kings' batters to 181 runs. They dismissed PBKS in just 17 overs and RCB won by 60 runs in a must-win match for both teams. The night match is scheduled to begin at 7:30 PM IST.\n\nIn Thursday's showdown, the victor will cling onto their faint playoff aspirations, while the vanquished will suffer the same fate as the Mumbai Indians, facing elimination from this season's race.\n\nRCB's transformation between their initial six matches and their most recent five is akin to witnessing two different teams on the field. Since their narrow defeat to the Sunrisers Hyderabad, falling short by just 25 runs in a pursuit of 288, RCB's batting lineup has undergone a remarkable revival. Their lowest total in the last five encounters stands at 152, achieved while chasing down 148 against the Gujarat Titans in Bengaluru. A resurgence led by Faf du Plessis finding form and a solid top four, featuring the likes of Virat Kohli, du Plessis, Will Jacks, and Rajat Patidar.\n\nDu Plessis has notched up two half-centuries in the recent five matches, contributing to RCB's increased scoring rate in the powerplay, soaring to 12.3 runs per over compared to their earlier 8.27. This shift has allowed for Jacks and Patidar to anchor the innings during the middle overs, capitalizing on additional risks taken in the initial phase. With more adept spin-hitters at their disposal, RCB has upped their scoring rate to 11.03 in the middle overs since April 15, a stark improvement from their 8.41 in previous matches.\n\nThis batting resurgence has also liberated Kohli, who has maintained consistency throughout IPL 2024, evident in his surge in strike rate from 141.77 in the first six games to 158.15 in the recent five matches. These factors set the stage for a crucial clash against PBKS at an opportune moment for RCB.\n\nPBKS have proven to be formidable away contenders but have struggled to find their footing at home. Having rotated between three home venues - Mohali, Dharamsala, and the latest addition Mullanpur - in the past two seasons, PBKS' home discomfort is apparent. In IPL 2024, they have secured victories in three out of five away fixtures but have stumbled to only one win in six encounters at home. Engineered to deliver uniform bounce and sustain its quality over the duration of the match, this innovative pitch sets a new standard in cricket surfaces.\n\nPBKS vs RCB Weather Conditions\n\nBy evening, Dharamsala anticipates a temperature hovering at approximately 20 degrees Celsius, with a perceived temperature of 18 degrees Celsius. {"uri": "8119693343", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "19:31:31", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T19:31:31Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T19:30:43Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7647058963775635, "url": "https://www.latestly.com/india/news/pbks-vs-rcb-ipl-2024-stat-highlights-virat-kohli-dinesh-karthik-register-new-records-as-royal-challengers-bengaluru-secure-dominant-victory-over-punjab-kings-5953496.html", "title": "PBKS vs RCB IPL 2024 Stat Highlights: Virat Kohli, Dinesh Karthik Register New Records As Royal Challengers Bengaluru Secure Dominant Victory Over Punjab Kings | \ud83d\udcf0 LatestLY", "body": "The result means RCB keep their Playoff hopes alive with their fourth win on the trot, while PBKS become the second team after Mumbai Indians to be eliminated from the tournament.\n\nVirat Kohli's majestic 92 off 47 balls, coupled with a collective bowling effort helped Royal Challengers Bengaluru get a 60-run win over Punjab Kings in Match 58 of Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 at the HPCA Stadium here on Thursday. Kohli hit seven fours and six maximums at a strike rate of 195.74 in his vintage knock which also took him past the 600-run mark in the IPL 2024. He was ably supported by Rajat Patidar's 55, his fourth fifty of this season as RCB posted 241/7, their fourth-highest total in the tournament. RCB Funny Memes and Jokes Go Viral After Royal Challengers Bengaluru Secure Dominating Win Over Punjab Kings in IPL 2024.\n\nFor PBKS, pacer Harshal Patel took 3-38, taking his IPL 2024 wickets tally to 20, while debutant fast-bowler Vidwath Kaverappa took 2-36, including a terrific Power-play spell, though the hosts were sloppy in their fielding. PBKS had a glimmer of hope to overhaul the total via a 65-run partnership between Jonny Bairstow and Rilee Rossouw. Though Rossouw made 61, none of PBKS's batters stood up as they were bowled out for 181 in 17 overs.\n\nKohli could have been out on the third ball of the innings if Ashutosh Sharma had not dropped a difficult catch at point off Kaverappa. Faf du Plessis got going with back-to-back fours through extra-cover off Kaverappa, who had the last laugh by having the RCB skipper hole out to deep point in the third over. In the same over of Kaverappa, Kohli got another life on 10 when Rilee Rossouw dropped another difficult catch at extra cover. Kohli and Will Jacks hit three boundaries collectively to take 16 runs off Sam Curran in the fourth over before Kaverappa had the latter sweeping to short fine leg.\n\nBut Kaverappa had to see the third catch dropped by PBKS off his bowling, as Patidar's chance was shelled by Harshal Patel at deep fine leg while on zero. Patidar smacked Harshal for three boundaries in a 12-run sixth over, before he and Kohli took a six each in Kaverappa's final over. Patidar stepped up the attack against spinners by smacking Rahul Chahar for three sixes in his first over and was given another life when Jonny Bairstow was late to react to a catch behind. He would get his fifty in 21 balls when he pulled Sam Curran over short fine-leg for six, before nicking behind to keeper off the left-arm pacer.\n\nFollowing a 33-minute rain and hail interruption, Kohli got his fifty in 32 balls with a vintage flick through mid-wicket for four off Liam Livingstone. He continued to nail authoritative boundaries mixed with nonchalance and vintage stroke-play to the delight of fans chanting 'Kohli, Kohli'. But Kohli fell eight runs short of his second century this season when he sliced an Arshdeep Singh delivery to deep third man in the 18th over. Dinesh Karthik hit three quick boundaries before holing out to long-on off Harshal, who castled Mahipal Lomror and had Cameron Green miscuing in the deep on the last ball of the innings.\n\nRCB had a superb start to their defence as Swapnil Singh trapped Prabhsimran Singh lbw on the fourth ball. Bairstow hit four boundaries and a six in his 16-ball 27, before falling to Lockie Ferguson on the second last ball of the powerplay. Rossouw kept PBKS in the hunt by smashing boundaries at will to hit his first fifty of the competition, which he reached by thumping a six over Green's head. After getting some attention from the physio for an injury, Rossouw holed out to long off against Karn Sharma, who went on to castle Jitesh Sharma.\n\nThough Shashank Singh was smashing boundaries, it wasn't enough for PBKS as Liam Livingstone was caught at cover for a duck, off a leading edge against Swapnil. Shashank himself needed attention from the physio for a shoulder injury and was run out by a direct hit fired by Kohli from deep mid-wicket on the very next ball, falling for 19-ball 37. After that, PBKS never recovered as Ashutosh was trapped lbw by Siraj, followed by Ferguson knocking over Sam Curran. Siraj came back to take out the remaining two wickets and finish with 3-43 as RCB managed another clinical win.\n\nPBKS vs RCB IPL 2024 Stat Highlights\n\n# 10th successive season PBKS has failed to make it to the Play Offs\n\n#PBKS are the only ones with a sub 40 win% at their home venue across the last two seasons\n\n#Second 50+ score for Rossouw in IPL. The first one also came at the same venue last year - 82* for DC vs PBKS.\n\n# This is the fourth highest totals for RCB in IPL (241/7)\n\n# Dinesh Karthik now has the second most runs by an Indian batter for RCB\n\n# Only the second instance of Virat Kohli getting dismissed in the 90s in IPL. The first was 99 vs Delhi Capitals in Delhi in 2013\n\n# PBKS is the third opposition against who Virat Kohli has scored 1000+ runs in IPL\n\n# Virat Kohli now has the most 1000+ runs against an opponent in IPL (3)\n\n# Virat Kohli now has the joint-most 600+ run seasons in IPL\n\n# RCB has the fourth highest average score at the end of 10th over batting first in IPL 2024 (92)\n\n# Rajat Patidar has the fifth-fastest fifty for RCB in IPL by balls faced (21). Punjab Kings lost their previous game against Chennai Super Kings at home by 28 runs which slimmed their playoff chances. Meanwhile, Royal Challengers Bengaluru have regrouped themselves well at the business end of the tournament and are unbeaten in their previous three games.\n\nMatch Details:\n\nPunjab Kings vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru, Match 58\n\nVenue: Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium, Dharamsala\n\nDate & Time: May 9th at 7:30 PM IST and Local Time\n\nLive Streaming: Star Sports Network and JioCinema\n\nWhat is the Pitch Report for PBKS vs RCB, IPL 2024, Match 58?\n\nIt's a tricky wicket and it takes some time for the players to get used to it, especially for the batters as we saw a middling score in the previous encounter between PBKS and CSK where 306 scored and 18 wickets have fallen. The upcoming game between PBKS and RCB is a night fixture and the dew factor will come into play which poses a challenge for the bowlers.\n\nRecent form:\n\nPunjab Kings: Lost, Won, Won, Lost, Lost\n\nRoyal Challengers Bengaluru: Won, Won, Won, Lost, Lost\n\nPBKS vs RCB, IPL 2024, Match 58 Probable Winners:\n\nRoyal Challengers Bengaluru are expected to win this match.\n\nWhat is the Expected, Probable Playing XIs for PBKS vs RCB, IPL 2024, Match 58?\n\nPunjab Kings\n\nPrabhsimran Singh / Arshdeep Singh, Jonny Bairstow, Rilee Rossouw, Shashank Singh, Sam Curran (c), Jitesh Sharma (wk), Ashutosh Sharma, Harpreet Brar, Harshal Patel, Rahul Chahar, Kagiso Rabada\n\nRoyal Challengers Bengaluru\n\nVirat Kohli, Faf du Plessis (c), Will Jacks, Rajat Patidar / Yash Dayal, Glenn Maxwell, Cameron Green, Dinesh Karthik (wk), Swapnil Singh, Karn Sharma, Mohammed Siraj, Vyshak Vijaykumar\n\nInjury Updates:\n\nShikhar Dhawan is still nursing an injury and he is likely to be available for Punjab Kings' final two matches.\n\nWhat are the Fantasy Cricket Top Picks, Players for PBKS vs RCB, IPL 2024, Match 58?\n\nTop Pick - Batter\n\nVirat Kohli scored 27 balls 42 against Gujarat Titans and gave a befitting reply for the critics who made a statement on his strike rate. He is the current Orange Cap holder in the IPL 2024, scoring 542 runs in 11 matches at an average of 67.75 with the best score of 113*.\n\nTop Pick - All-Rounder\n\nSam Curran hasn't played to his huge price tag but provides the balance that the Punjab Kings asked for. In 11 matches, he picked up 13 wickets with the best figures of 3 for 28 and struck 185 runs in 10 innings.\n\nTop Pick - Bowler\n\nRahul Chahar was the show stopper with the ball for Punjab Kings in the last two matches, picking up 5 wickets with the best figures of 3 for 23.\n\nTop Pick - Wicketkeeper\n\nPrabhsimran Singh looks in great nick at the top of the order for Punjab Kings. His last four innings scores are 30, 13, 54 and 35.\n\nX-Factor:\n\nShashank Singh has turned out to be the main man for Punjab Kings in the middle order. He scored valuable runs in the tournament, hammering 315 runs in 11 matches at an average of 63.\n\nWhat are the Fantasy Suggested teams for PBKS vs RCB, IPL 2024, Match 58?\n\n1. The bowlers put up a clinical show earlier where Rahul Chahar and Harshal Patel stood out picking up 3 wickets apiece. It's disappointing to see the batters turn out as they could only make 139 at the end of the 20 overs. With playoffs fast approaching they must win their remaining 3 matches to stay in the hunt. Currently, they are placed 8th in the standings with 8 points. Shikhar Dhawan is still recovering from injury and might be fit to play the final two league games.\n\nRoyal Challengers Bengaluru might have returned to form at the wrong time but 3 back to back wins under their belt gave them the slightest of playoff hopes with 3 matches in hand. Thumping away victories over Sunrisers and Titans reignited their confidence and the follow-up home win over Titans even made the difference for their self-belief as they are dreaming of playoff qualification which is far away from now. In the first leg of the fixture, the Faf du Plessis-led side won the game by 4 wickets in what was a thriller. But overall, Punjab have the upper hand as they have won 17 matches over the opposition, who have 15 wins.\n\nThe game between PBKS and RCB will be a knockout game for both teams. They have 8 points under their belt. On the other hand, PBKS are 8th on the points table with the same number of wins and defeats in 11 games.\n\nRCB will be high on confidence entering into the game. They have played a magnificent brand of cricket in the last few games they have played and have won three matches on the trot. Punjab Kings on the other hand had a good run until the last game, where they suffered a thrashing loss to Chennai Super Kings.\n\nThe game between PBKS and RCB will be extremely crucial in the context of the game. Whoever wins the game will stay alive for the playoffs spot. PBKS is in ninth place, with four wins and eight losses, a total of eight points. Punjab is out of the tournament.\n\nIn the run-chase of 242 runs, Punjab Kings lost their opener Prabhsimran Singh early for just six runs in four balls to Swapnil Singh after he trapped him leg-before-wicket.\n\nRilee Rossoue was the next up on the crease and made pressure on bowlers right from ball one, smashing Swapnil for two fours on his first two balls.\n\nOpener Jonny Bairstow and Rossouw eventually caught momentum and started to hit RCB bowlers all over the park. Rossouw looted 18 runs from Mohammed Siraj's over number four, smashing a six and three fours.\n\nWith a cracking six at the start of the next over by Yash Dayal, PBKS reached their 50-run mark in 4.1 overs. Dayal's over gave away 16 runs, including four each by Rossouw and Bairstow and six by Bairstow.\n\nBairstow tried to end the powerplay on high, smashing Lockie Ferguson for two fours, but a diving catch by Faf Du Plessis ended his innings at 27 in 16 balls, with four boundaries and a six. PBKS was 71/2 in 5.5 overs.\n\nRossouw and Shashank Singh continued their innings unfazed, with Rossouw being the key aggressor. Rossouw reached his second fifty in just 21 balls, with eight fours and two sixes.\n\nPBKS reached their 100-run mark in 8.2 overs with a crackling boundary through the cover region by Rossouw. However, the bowler Karn Sharma had a last laugh, removing Rossouw for 61 in 27 balls, with nine fours and three sixes. Will Jacks complete a fine catch. PBKS was 107/3 in nine overs.\n\nAt the end of 10 overs, PBKS was 114/3, with Shashank Singh (18*) and Jitesh Sharma (1*) unbeaten.\n\nRCB bowlers solidified their hold on the game, getting Jitesh Sharma (5) dismissed by Karn and Liam Livingstone dismissed by Swapnil for a duck. Half of the PBKS team was back in the hut for 126 runs in 11.2 overs.\n\nShashank tried to keep the run-rate going and his team's hopes alive. PBKS reached the 150-run mark in 13.3 overs. However, Shashank was run out by Virat for 37 in 19 balls, with four boundaries and two sixes. PBKS was 151/6 in 13.4 overs.\n\nSiraj then soon helped RCB get the big wicket of Ashutosh Sharma, trapping him lbw for just eight runs. PBKS was 164/7 in 15 overs.\n\nFerguson got Sam Curran cleaned up for 22in 16 balls, with two fours and Harshal was dismissed by Siraj for zero. PBKS was 174/9 in 16.1 overs.\n\nSiraj got his third wicket, removing Arshdeep for four runs, with a fine catch from Karn. RCB bundled out PBKS for 181 runs in 17 overs, winning by 60 runs.\n\nSiraj (3/43) was the pick of the bowlers for RCB. Lockie (2/29), Swapnil (2/28) and Karn (2/36) also impressed with the ball.\n\nEarlier, Virat Kohli's fiery 92-run knock powered Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) to 241/7 against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 at the Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium on Thursday.\n\nThe RCB batters displayed a stupendous performance in Dharamsala and gave a solid target in a must-win match in IPL 2024.\n\nAfter winning the toss, Sam Curran's Punjab Kings sent RCB to bat first, however, their decision did not go in their favour.\n\nKohli (92) and Faf du Plessis (9) opened for the visitors. Even though the skipper failed to make a mark in the game but Kohli did not make his absence felt on the crease.\n\nThe RCB openers could only make a partnership of 19 runs after Faf was dismissed by Vidhwath Kaverappa in the third over of the first inning. The Proteas batter smashed just 2 fours at a strike rate of 128.57.\n\nSoon after the first dismissal, RCB lost Will Jacks (12) in the 5th over, when the visitors were at 43/2. Jacks slammed just one four and six.\n\nHowever, Kohli played a 76-run knock partnership with Rajat Patidar (55) who was stupendous on the crease as he slammed 3 fours and 6 sixes during his time on the field.\n\nIn the 10th over, Patidar lost his wicket to Sam Curran. But it did not stop RCB from adding runs on the scoreboard.\n\nSoon after replacing Patidar, Cameron Green (46) started hitting. The pair Kohli-Green played a 92-run partnership and helped RCB to cross the 200-run mark in the 18th over.\n\nThe star Indian batter was in his red-hot form but was unlucky to miss his century as he was dismissed in the 18th over by Arshdeep Singh. He hammered 7 fours and 6 sixes at a strike rate of 195.74.\n\nAfter the dismissal of Kohli, RCB started losing wickets quickly.\n\nHarshal Patel was on fire in the final over the first inning as he dismissed Dinesh Karthik (18), Mahipal Lomror (0), and Cameron Green (46) all in one over. However, it was very late, as the RCB batters had already done the destruction and put 241/7 on the scoreboard.\n\nHarshal Patel led the Punjab Kings bowling attack as he picked up three wickets in his four-over spell. Kaverappa bagged 2 wickets. While Arshdeep Singh and Sam Curran took one wicket each in their respective spells.\n\nPBKS need to make 242 runs to win the match against the Bengaluru-based franchise in Dharamsala.\n\nBrief score: Royal Challengers Bengaluru 241/7 (Virat Kohli 92, Rajat Patidar 55, Cameron Green 46; Harshal Patel 3/38) beat Punjab Kings: 181 in 17 overs (Rilee Rossouw 61, Shashank Singh 37, Mohammed Siraj 3/43). Vidwath Kaverappa bowled a full-length delivery on off and Kohli looked to whip it through the on-side but it swung away and went high in the air off a leading edge.\n\nAshutosh jogged back from the point while trying to settle underneath the ball. run-getter's list this season.\n\nKohli became the first batter this season to go past the 600-run mark and now has 634 runs to his name in 12 matches at an average of 70.44 with the help of five fifties and a century.\n\nRajat Patidar also played a magnificent innings of 55 runs in 23 balls with the help of three fours and six sixes whereas Cameron Green contributed 46 runs.\n\nGreen smashed Harpreet Brar and Rahul Chahar gave away a combination of 4/33 in their eight overs. Even though Brar had a poor first and only over in their next game, giving away 19 of the over, Chahar ended with 3/23 in his four overs. However, at this business end of their tournament, they will look to get the services of their captain Shikhar Dhawan back.\n\nFor the last few game, Bengaluru bowlers seemed to get their mojo back. In their last game at home, RCB blew away the Titans for just 147 runs in 19.3 overs, as Mohammad Siraj picked up 2/29 in his four overs. The chance of speed, with variations, and different field placement helped them in the bowling.\n\nAlso Read: 'They Used MS Dhoni's Own Medicine Against Him'- Navjot Singh Sidhu On Master Stroke\n\nThe Punjab side missed some responsibility in their middle order. Once the top order made a tough start, no one stood there for long. Even the bowling in the death over is under a bit of scanner.\n\nJonny Bairstow and Prabhsimran Singh have gifted Punjab a few really good starts in this season. The former has managed 257 runs in 11 innings at an average of 32.12 at a strike rate of 163.69 with a century, and no fifties. Prabhsimran, on the other hand, has managed 251 runs in 11 innings at a strike rate of 156.87. But of them are in the top 25 run-scorers of the league.\n\nOne of the biggest positives for them is Shashank Singh, who has smashed 315 runs in 11 innings at a strike rate of over 165 with a couple of half-centuries. Even though he is the highest run-getter for the hosts before the PBKS vs RCB clash, he is not among the top 20 in the list.\n\nWhile in the bowling department, they have Harshal Patel, who is the second-highest wicket-taker of this IPL 2024, with 17 scalps in 11 innings at an economy of 9.78. Arshdeep Singh has nailed 15 wickets in the same number of innings, but at an economy of 10.06, which is quite on the higher side.\n\nPBKS's line-up vs RCB: Prabhsimran Singh, Jonny Bairstow, Shashank Singh, Rilee Rossouw/ Liam Livingstone, Sam Curran (c), Jitesh Sharma (wk.), Ashutosh Sharma, Harpreet Brar, Rahul Chahar, Kagiso Rabada, Harshal Patel. (Impact Sub: Arshdeep Singh).\n\nBoth the openers Virat Kohli and Faf du Plessis have been in aggressive touch in this IPL 2024 for the Bengaluru franchise. The former captain is the leading run-getter of the season, before the PBKS vs RCB clash, with 542 runs in 11 innings at a strike rate of close to 150 with four fifties and one century.\n\nAlso Read: 'How Do You Fit Him In?'- Josh Hazlewood On Jake Fraser-McGurk T20 World Cup Omission\n\nFaf, after a difficult beginning in this season, has 352 runs in 11 innings at a strike rate of 172.54 with three fifties. Rajat Patidar and Will Jacks have shown their spin game, as the former has 213 runs in this IPL with a strike rate of close to 175.\n\nMohammad Siraj has been inconsistent in this IPL with just eight scalps at an economy of 9.26, while their best bowler going into the PBKS vs RCB encounter still is Yash Dayal with 10 scalps at an economy of 8.89. The spinners need to raise their hands going forward.\n\nRCB's line-up vs PBKS: Virat Kohli, Faf du Plessis (c), Will Jacks, Cameron Green, Rajat Patidar, Glenn Maxwell, Dinesh Karthik (wk.), Swapnil Singh, Karn Sharma, Mohammad Siraj. With Kagiso Rabada unwell, youngster Vidwath Kaverappa underlined his potential on debut, claiming the wickets of RCB captain Faf du Plessis and Will Jacks, after he was denied a dream start when Ashutosh Sharma dropped Kohli on the third ball of the match.\n\nRELATED: PBKS vs RCB Highlights\n\nKohli got another life in Kaverappa's second over as Rossouw dropped a difficult take. Even before the bowler could come to terms with his misfortune, Harshal Patel put down Patidar (on zero). Those misses went on to hurt Kings.\n\nOnce the two batters settled down, they tore the bowlers apart. Kohli went after the pacers, while Patidar began with three boundaries off Harshal and followed it up with three sixes off leg-spinner Rahul Chahar in the eighth over.\n\nHis sparkling fifty -- his fourth in this edition -- set up a run-fest as a few Kings bowlers conceded at least 12 an over. Patidar then fell to Sam Curran.\n\nRELATED: PBKS vs RCB Match Scorecard\n\nDespite the rain interruption, Kohli remained focused and brought up his fifty with a four off Liam Livingstone. He struck a flurry of boundaries and added 92 for the fourth wicket with Cameron Green before falling eight short of what would have been his 100th ton in all formats.\n\nRilee Rossouw's 27-ball-61 kept the Kings in the hunt. He forged a 65-run second wicket stand with Jonny Bairstow to help the Kings to 75 for two in the Powerplay. But once Rossouw fell to Karn Sharma, RCB bounced back with Mohammed Siraj and Lockie Ferguson claiming quick wickets.\n\nLatest on SportstarPBKS vs RCB, IPL 2024: Royal Challengers Bengaluru live to He hammered 7 fours and 6 sixes at a strike rate of 195.74.\n\nAfter the dismissal of Kohli, RCB started losing wickets quickly.\n\nHarshal Patel was on fire in the final over the first inning as he dismissed Dinesh Karthik (18), Mahipal Lomror (0), and Cameron Green (46) all in one over. Kaverappa bagged 2 wickets. Will Jacks fell for 12, mistiming a slower ball from Kaverappa towards short fine leg. Kohli and Rajat Patidar (55 off 23) lifted RCB, adding 76 runs for the third wicket.\n\nBoth batters were in tremendous big-hitting rhythm. Patidar clobbered three fours and six sixes to get to his fifty off 21 balls. He reached the landmark by top-edging a pull off Sam Curran for a maximum. On the other hand, RCB are coming in with a win by four wickets over the Gujarat Titans (GT). RCB's bowling attack displayed their best performance of the season in their last game as they bowled out GT for just 147 runs.\n\nWith this win, RCB are in the seventh spot and their hopes of qualifying are almost over until the other teams start losing points. The win over Punjab Kings (PBKS) in the 58th game of the tournament has revived the hopes of the fans their team can still reach the top 4.\n\nPunjab Kings (PBKS) hosted Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) at the Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium (HPCA) in Dharamsala. The match between the two teams, which was also a virtual eliminator, took place on Thursday (9th May).\n\nRoyal Challengers Bengaluru were asked to bat first and it was a sensational outing for them. Even though Faf du Plessis (9) and Will Jacks (12) lost their wickets early, it was Virat Kohli's show with the bat at the Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium in Dharamsala as he oozed his class with the bat.\n\nRajat Patidar (55) slammed a brutal half-century as well that put Punjab Kings under pressure. He along with Kohli added 76 runs and bailed the team out of trouble when they had two early wickets. After that Cameron Green joined Kohli and the duo did further carnage.\n\nVirat Kohli scored 92 runs, while Green ended with innings of 46 runs, based on their terrific effort with the bat, Royal Challengers Bengaluru posted a gigantic total of 241 runs on the board at the Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium in Dharamsala.\n\nPunjab Kings started the chase pretty well even though they lost Prabhsimran Singh early. Jonny Bairstow (27) and Rilee Rossouw (61) kept their team in the hunt. After that, Shashank Singh (37) played vital innings but none of them could play a big hand.\n\nRoyal Challengers Bengaluru bowlers were all over the Punjab Kings batters and bundled them out for 181 runs to win the game by 60. With the win, they kept themselves alive in the Indian Premier League and knocked out opposition from the tournament.\n\nThe win against the Punjab Kings was their 5th win in the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024. Win the win they solidified their 7th position at the points table with 10 points under their belt. They also boosted their NRR to +0.217, which might be handy for them going ahead.\n\nTo make it into the playoffs, Royal Challengers Bengaluru will need to win their next two games of the IPL 2024. If they manage to do so they will go to 14 points, which might turn out to be a qualification mark.\n\nBut the road isn't easy for them as apart from winning their next two games, they also need some other results to go their way. The last time these two sides faced each other in Bengaluru, RCB registered a four-wicket victory.\n\nPunjab is currently in the middle of a poor run after losing seven out of their 11 matches. Sam Curran and Co. registered two back-to-back wins against Kolkata Knight Riders and Chennai Super Kings, before losing their previous game to Chennai in the same venue. PBKS and CSK locked horns for the second time this season, earlier this week. The visitors managed to play a controlled inning against the dangerous bowling line-up of PBKS. With decent batting performances from Ruturaj Gaikwad (32) and Daryl Mitchell (30) at the top and a 26 ball-43 from Ravindra Jadeja, the defending champions ended their innings at 167/9. Harshal Patel and Rahul Chahar shared six wickets between them.\n\nComing to the chase, Punjab batters couldn't construct a much-required partnership in the middle, to take their side over the line. Prabhsimran Singh (30) and Shashank Singh (27) were the only notable performers with the bat. All thanks to Jadeja's all-round effort, Chennai managed to register their sixth win of the season.\n\nMeanwhile, RCB won only one out of their first eight games but have managed to win three games on the bounce against Sunrisers Hyderabad and twice against Gujarat Titans. The Faf du Plessis and Co. currently sit at the seventh position in the points table with just eight points in their kitty from 11 games. With three of their league games left in this season, the Bengaluru-based franchise will have to win all their remaining matches and hope that other results also go their way as they look to sneak into the playoffs.\n\nStar batter Virat Kohli is having yet another prolific season, having scored 542 runs from 11 matches at an average of 67.75 and a strike rate of 148.08. He has already hit four half-centuries and a century. The side has also found their other batters contributing with runs. Skipper Faf, from the past few matches, has been seen back at his regular best. English batter Will Jacks, who smashed a century against Gujarat Titans has also shown promise. Glenn Maxwell's form has been a talking point in this season.\n\nMohammed Siraj was expected to be the spearhead of the RCB bowling department but he has been far from his best. In ten matches, he has taken just eight wickets. Yash Dayal, who was picked up in the IPL 2024 auction, has fared slightly better, having taken ten wickets in ten games. Both of them will have an important role to play on Thursday.\n\nPBKS are currently placed at No. 8 on the points table, with four wins in 11 games. Meanwhile, RCB is positioned at No. 7, having registered four wins and seven losses so far in IPL 2024.\n\nThe HPCA Stadium in Dharamshala is known for its pace and bounce, making it a preferred venue for fast bowlers. Ahead of the IPL 2024 season, the Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium installed a new hybrid pitch, the first of its kind in India. The team that wins the toss at this venue will likely choose to bowl first, taking advantage of the conducive surface for their bowlers.\n\nPunjab Kings' regular captain Shikhar Dhawan's availability remains uncertain due to an injury, which means Sam Curran might have to lead the team once again. PBKS had won two consecutive matches before losing their previous game against Chennai Super Kings. The batting department has been a major area of concern for the side this season, as apart from Shashank Singh and Ashutosh Sharma, none of the other batters have been consistent throughout the tournament. At this crucial stage of the season, they are unlikely to make changes to their line-up unless faced with unexpected injury concerns.\n\nPredicted XI: Jonny Bairstow, Rilee Rossouw, Sam Curran (C), Jitesh Sharma (WK), Shashank Singh, Ashutosh Sharma, Harpreet Brar, Harshal Patel, Kagiso Rabada, Arshdeep Singh, Rahul Chahar\n\nRCB brought back the struggling Glenn Maxwell into their playing XI, but his performance has been disappointing. Despite being in the seventh position on the points table, the Bengaluru franchise is still mathematically in contention for a playoff spot. The team is currently on a three-match winning streak and will be aiming to extend it to four victories. The highlight of their innings was a scintillating knock by former skipper Virat Kohli, who blazed his way to 92 runs off just 47 deliveries, including 7 fours and 6 sixes. Contributions from Rajat Patidar (55 off 23) and Cameron Green (46 off 27) further bolstered RCB's total.\n\nPunjab's bowling attack struggled to contain the RCB batters, with notable performances coming from Harshal Patel (3/38) and Vidhwath Kaverappa (2/36).\n\nMohammed Siraj, Lockie Ferguson shine with the ball\n\nChasing a mammoth target of 242 runs for victory, Punjab Kings' batting lineup showed glimpses of brilliance but ultimately fell short. {"uri": "8119612323", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "18:18:49", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T18:18:49Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T18:17:48Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.686274528503418, "url": "https://www.news18.com/cricket/ipl-2024-pbks-vs-rcb-virat-kohli-stars-as-royal-challengers-bengaluru-knock-punjab-kings-out-with-60-run-win-8884603.html", "title": "IPL 2024, PBKS vs RCB: Virat Kohli Stars as Royal Challengers Bengaluru Knock Punjab Kings Out with 60-Run Win - News18", "body": "IPL 2024, PBKS vs RCB: Royal Challengers Bengaluru beat Punjab Kings by 60 runs to knock them out of the playoff race.\n\nRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) defeated Punjab Kings (PBKS) by 60 runs in the 2024 Indian Premier League (IPL) clash at the Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium in Dharamsala on Thursday.\n\nWith the win, RCB reached 10 points from 12 games but stayed in seventh spot in the IPL 2024 points table. PBSK, on the other hand, were knocked out of the playoffs race.\n\nIPL 2024: Punjab Kings vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru - HIGHLIGHTS\n\nSwapnil Singh trapped Prabhsimran Singh LBW after being hit for a maximum in the first over. Jonny Bairstow and Rilee Rossouw then sticthed together a fifty-run stand for the second wicket to get PBKS back in the game. The former was removed just before the end of the powerplay thanks to a stunning catch from Faf du Plessis off the bowling of Lockie Ferguson. Bairstow departed for 27 from 16 deliveries.\n\nRossouw scored a well-made 27-ball 61 but was dismissed by Karn Sharma as Will Jacks completed the catch.\n\nEarlier, Virat Kohli's 92 off 47 balls powered RCB to 241/7 in 20 overs against PBKS, their fourth-highest overall total in the tournament.\n\nKohli hit seven fours and six sixes at a strike-rate of 195.74 in his vintage knock which also took him past the 600-run mark in IPL 2024. He was ably supported by Rajat Patidar, who struck 55, his fourth fifty of the season.\n\nFor PBKS, pacer Harshal Patel took 3-38, taking his IPL 2024 wickets tally to 20, while debutant fast-bowler Vidwath Kaverappa took 2-36, including a terrific Power-play spell, though the hosts were sloppy in their fielding.\n\nKohli could have been out on the third ball of the innings if Ashutosh Sharma had not dropped a difficult catch at point off Kaverappa. Faf du Plessis got going with back-to-back fours through extra-cover off Kaverappa, who had the last laugh by having the RCB skipper hole out to deep point in the third over.\n\nIn the same over of Kaverappa, Kohli got another life on 10 when Rilee Rossouw dropped another difficult catch at extra cover. Kohli and Will Jacks hit three boundaries collectively to take 16 runs off Sam Curran in the fourth over before Kaverappa had the latter sweeping to short fine-leg.\n\nBut Kaverappa had to see a third catch dropped by PBKS off his bowling, as Patidar's chance was shelled by Harshal Patel at deep fine-leg while on zero. Patidar smacked Harshal for three boundaries in a 12-run sixth over, before he and Kohli took a six each in Kaverappa's final over.\n\nPatidar stepped up the attack against spinners by smacking Rahul Chahar for three sixes in his first over and was given another life when Jonny Bairstow was late to react to a catch behind. He would get his fifty in 21 balls when he pulled Sam Curran over a short fine leg for six, before nicking behind to keeper off the left-arm pacer.\n\nFollowing a 33-minute rain and hail interruption, Kohli got his fifty in 32 balls with a vintage flick through mid-wicket for four off Liam Livingstone. He continued to nail authoritative boundaries mixed with nonchalance and vintage stroke-play to the delight of fans chanting 'Kohli, Kohli'.\n\nBut Kohli fell eight runs short of his second century this season when he sliced an Arshdeep Singh delivery to deep third man in the 18th over. This match, on May 9, has massive playoff implications, with the loser facing potential elimination from the race for the coveted IPL trophy.\n\nRCB will be riding a wave of confidence after their three consecutive wins. They even recorded a victory over PBKS earlier this season. Virat Kohli, the current Orange Cap holder, has been in top form and will be a key player to watch.\n\nFor PBKS, this is a do-or-die encounter as well. Their batting, reliant on players like Jonny Bairstow and Shashank Singh, needs to fire on all cylinders. Bowling remains a concern, but Harshal Patel has been their bright spark with his wicket-taking abilities.\n\nAs both teams gear up at the picturesque Dharamsala, here are three potential milestones that could be reached in the PBKS vs. RCB clash.\n\n#3 Faf Du Plessis could complete 4500 IPL runs\n\nFaf Du Plessis is one of the most underrated batters in IPL history. The RCB skipper is enjoying a stellar campaign, having scored 352 runs at a strike rate of 172.55.\n\nDu Plessis could complete his 4,500 runs in the cash-rich league. The former IPL winner is only 15 runs away from achieving the landmarks. In doing so, he would become only the fourth overseas player to complete 4,500 IPL runs.\n\nAcross the 141 matches he has played, the South African star has amassed 4,985 runs at a strike rate of 136.5.\n\n#2 Arshdeep Singh could become the second-highest wicket-taker in PBKS history\n\nArshdeep Singh has a golden opportunity in this high-stakes encounter to etch his name further into PBKS history. With 72 wickets to his name for PBKS, he stands just one wicket away from surpassing Sandeep Sharma (73 wickets) to become the franchise's second-highest wicket-taker.\n\nThe left-arm pacer has been a consistent performer for Punjab Kings, especially in the death overs. His ability to swing the new ball and nail his yorkers makes him a vital cog in their bowling attack.\n\n#1 Virat Kohli could become the first Indian to score 1000 runs vs PBKS\n\nIPL legend Virat Kohli will be eyeing another landmark achievement as he steps onto the field in Dharamshala. Currently sitting at 938 runs against Punjab Kings in just 31 matches, Kohli is on the cusp of becoming the first Indian batter to breach the 1000-run mark against this particular franchise.\n\nJust 62 runs separate him from this historic feat. PTI\n\nA resurgent Royal Challengers Bengaluru will look for their fourth consecutive victory when they face an unpredictable Punjab Kings as the two sides fight for survival in the Indian Premier League, here on Thursday.\n\nAfter a horrendous start to the season, RCB have managed to claw their way back into the tournament. They have the winning momentum on their side, having won their last three games comprehensively.\n\nThe wins have not only boosted their sagging morale but also taken them to the seventh spot in the points table.\n\nWith eight points from 11 games, RCB can still make the playoffs if they win all their remaining three fixtures although the chances are slim.\n\nPunjab Kings too stare at a similar situation. They occupy the eighth spot, having collected eight points from 11 games.\n\nHowever, between the two -- only one team can reach the all-important 14 points mark.\n\nHaving beaten PBKS earlier in the season and heading to this clash with three wins on the trot, RCB will feel more confident than the hosts.\n\nVirat Kohli remains consistent at the top, while skipper Faf du Plessis broke his string of poor scores with a belligerent knock in the last game.\n\nWill Jacks also impressed with a match-winning century against GT, and Cameron Green showcased his all-round skills with crucial contributions in runs and wickets against Sunrisers Hyderabad.\n\nTheir bowling department has started clicking with Mohammed Siraj, who is in India's T20 World Cup squad, finally finding his rhythm.\n\nYash Dayal and Vijaykumar Vyshak also did well against GT and RCB will expect them to continue in the same vein.\n\nPBKS, on the other hand, will be low on confidence having suffered an inexplicable batting collapse against Chennai Super Kings.\n\nThe Kings showcased their very best and worst against CSK. Their bowlers were all over the CSK batters but the batting unit choked.\n\nIt was a example of how Punjab's season has been this year -- unpredictable.\n\nThey have showcased their potential with away wins over Kolkata Knight Riders, when they recorded the highest successful run chase in T20 cricket, and CSK.\n\nHowever, they have faced difficulties getting the job done at home. They won just one out of five games in Mullanpur, their main home ground.\n\nA change in venue to the Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium also didn't go their way in the previous game here.\n\nThe team would hope to end its home run on a high but for that to happen, the PBKS unit has to fire in unison.\n\nSquads:\n\nPunjab Kings: Sam Curran \u00a9, Matthew Short, Jonny Bairstow They have the winning momentum on their side, having won their last three games comprehensively.\n\nThe wins have not only boosted their sagging morale but also taken them to the seventh spot in the points table.\n\nWith eight points from 11 games, RCB can still make the playoffs if they win all their remaining three fixtures although the chances are slim.\n\nPunjab Kings too stare at a similar situation. They occupy the eighth spot, having collected eight points from 11 games.\n\nHowever, between the two -- only one team can reach the all-important 14 points mark.\n\nHaving beaten PBKS earlier in the season and heading to this clash with three wins on the trot, RCB will feel more confident than the hosts.\n\nVirat Kohli remains consistent at the top, while skipper Faf du Plessis broke his string of poor scores with a belligerent knock in the last game.\n\nWill Jacks also impressed with a match-winning century against GT, and Cameron Green showcased his all-round skills with crucial contributions in runs and wickets against Sunrisers Hyderabad.\n\nTheir bowling department has started clicking with Mohammed Siraj, who is in India's T20 World Cup squad, finally finding his rhythm.\n\nYash Dayal and Vijaykumar Vyshak also did well against GT and RCB will expect them to continue in the same vein.\n\nPBKS, on the other hand, will be low on confidence having suffered an inexplicable batting collapse against Chennai Super Kings.\n\nThe Kings showcased their very best and worst against CSK. Their bowlers were all over the CSK batters but the batting unit choked.\n\nIt was a example of how Punjab's season has been this year -- unpredictable.\n\nThey have showcased their potential with away wins over Kolkata Knight Riders, when they recorded the highest successful run chase in T20 cricket, and CSK.\n\nHowever, they have faced difficulties getting the job done at home. They won just one out of five games in Mullanpur, their main home ground.\n\nA change in venue to the Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium also didn't go their way in the previous game here.\n\nThe team would hope to end its home run on a high but for that to happen, the PBKS unit has to fire in unison.\n\nSquads: Punjab Kings: Sam Curran (c), Matthew Short, Jonny Bairstow (wk), {"uri": "8119708712", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "19:45:58", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T19:45:58Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T19:45:14Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6666666865348816, "url": "https://www.aninews.in/news/sports/cricket/gotta-keep-our-heads-up-pbks-skipper-sam-curran-after-defeat-to-rcb20240510011434/", "title": "\"Gotta keep our heads up\": PBKS skipper Sam Curran after defeat to RCB", "body": "Ahmedabad (Gujarat) [India], May 10 (ANI): After his side's 60-run loss against Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) in the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024, Punjab Kings (PBKS) skipper Sam Curran said they need to keep their heads up.\n\nFollowing the loss at the Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium, the Punjab Kings are out of the tournament as they stand in ninth place in the IPL 2024 standings with 8 points after winning four of 12 matches. They have a net run rate of -0.423.\n\nWhile speaking after the match, Curran said there have been lots of positive signs in the ongoing season of the IPL 2024.\n\nHe further added they need to keep learning and become better in the future. The skipper also apologised to the home fans after conceding a defeat against RCB.\n\n\"A lot of positive signs throughout the season, but not enough to get over the line unfortunately. We knew that we had the best side for the rest of the tournament and feel gutted for the team. Gotta keep our heads up, keep learning and keep becoming better. Really enjoyed leading a great bunch of guys, would have loved a few more wins. We had some highs, and some record run-chases as well. Lots of disappointment and apologies to the fans, we will keep fighting. The ups and downs have been quite tough, but you gotta keep learning and keep working hard,\" Curran said.\n\nRecapping the match, PBKS opted to field first after winning the toss. After the dismissal of skipper Faf Du Plessis (9) and Will Jacks (12) early, Virat (92) and Rajat Patidar (55) steadied the RCB's ship with a 76-run stand, keeping the strike rate high. Then, a fine knock by Cameron Green (46) and his 92-run stand with Virat powered RCB to 241/7 in their 20 overs.\n\nHarshal Patel (3/38) was the pick of the bowlers for PBKS. Vidwath Kaverappa (2/36) also did fine on his debut.\n\nIn the run-chase of 242 runs for PBKS, Rilee Rossouw (61), Shashank Singh (37) and Jonny Bairstow (27) looked dangerous, but lost their wickets on crucial stages.\n\nThe rest of the batters could not really put up a fight and lost the game by 60 runs as PBKS bundled out for 181 runs.\n\nMohammed Siraj was the top bowler for RCB with 3/43. Karn Sharma, Lockie Ferguson and Swapnil Singh also took two wickets. RCB secured their 4th win on the trot on the back of Kohli's 92 off 47 deliveries as PBKS struggled to chase down the target of 242. RCB had a poor start to the campaign, which saw them win just 1 out of 7 matches before going on the winning streak.\n\nSpeaking after the 60-run win over PBKS, Kohli said that the team wasn't good enough in the first half of the competition. The star batter went on to say that things had reached a point where RCB had to play for pride and not look at the points table and were just looking to keep the fans happy.\n\n\"Have to be honest, we were not good enough in the first half of the tournament. We got to a point where we said don't look at the table, play for self-respect. Make yourselves proud and the fans,\" said Kohli.\n\nPBKS vs RCB: Highlights | Scorecard\n\nKohli went on to say that RCB would need to keep raising their level as if they had done it earlier, they wouldn't have been in a scenario where they need to depend on other results.\n\nWe need to raise our level. If we had done so earlier, we wouldn't be in a position needing to rely on so many factors,\" said Kohli.\n\nThe match saw Kohli, along with Rajat Patidar and Cameron Green, help RCB post 241 runs in their 20 overs, giving PBKS a big mountain to climb. The Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium in Dharamshala is playing host to this encounter.\n\nPBKS captain Sam Curran won the toss and invited the opposition team to bat first on a flat surface. RCB top-order batters Faf du Plessis (9) and Will Jacks (12) departed early in the innings without much contributions. Virat Kohli and Rajat Patidar then put on a brisk partnership of 76 (32) to inject momentum into the innings and lay down a solid platform.\n\nPatidar was the aggressor as he scored 55 (23) before perishing at the end of the 10th over. Virat Kohli took over the mantle in the second half of the innings and played a magnificent knock of 92 (47) to take RCB above the 200-run mark.\n\nCameron Green (46) supported him well as the duo stitched together a 92-run partnership for the fourth wicket. Dinesh Karthik (18) chipped in with a cameo in the end as RCB reached a massive score of 241 in 20 overs.\n\nFans enjoyed the first innings of the 58th match of IPL 2024 between RCB and PBKS. They expressed their reactions to the action by sharing hilarious memes on X and Instagram.\n\nHere are some of the best memes:\n\n\"We thought anything over 230 would be great\" - Virat Kohli after helping RCB reach 241/7 in IPL 2024 match against PBKS\n\nAt the mid-innings break, Royal Challengers Bengaluru batter Virat Kohli reflected on the action that unfolded during the first innings. He told the host broadcaster:\n\n\"It was important to keep the strike rate up throughout the innings. There was a bit of tricky phase when Patidar got out and rain came. Green got a couple of boundaries and then I thought it's time for me to go after the bowling. When the seamers were bowling up front, it was two-paced. It was dry and the ball was stopping it.\"\n\nHe added:\n\n\"Due to the two-pace nature, it's an opportunity for our pacers to exploit the swing. We thought anything over 230 would be great. We have a great bowling attack and the bowlers are confident. RCB were off to a disastrous start as Vidhwath Kaverappa dismissed their captain Faf du Plessis (9) and Will Jacks (12) cheaply inside the powerplay.\n\nHowever, the former India skipper stood firm at one end to take RCB to the big total. {"uri": "8116626877", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "04:17:12", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T04:17:12Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T04:16:30Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6549019813537598, "url": "https://cricketaddictor.com/cricket-news/pbks-vs-rcb-weather-report-live-today-and-pitch-report-of-dharamsala-ipl-2024-match-58/", "title": "PBKS vs RCB Weather Report Live Today And Pitch Report Of Dharamsala- IPL 2024, Match 58", "body": "HPCA Stadium in Dharamsala is all set to welcome Punjab Kings and Royal Challengers Bangalore on its soil for match 58 of IPL 2024. PBKS vs RCB encounter takes place on Thursday, May 9.\n\nSam Curran leads Punjab Kings in IPL 2024 after the ouster of injured Shikhar Dhawan. Faf du Plessis is the captain of Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Both teams have had a poor season in IPL 2024.\n\nPunjab Kings have won 4 games and lost 7 in the tournament and account for 8 points. Royal Challengers Bangalore have also won 4 games and lost 7 and have 8 points.\n\nHence, the winner of the PBKS vs RCB encounter will better their position in the points table. Ahead of the PBKS vs RCB clash, we look at the weather and pitch reports of the Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium in Dharamsala.\n\nAlso Read: \"It doesn't matter if Virat Kohli is in those 1st 6 overs..\"- Matthew Hayden's fresh tirade\n\nThe PBKS vs RCB encounter of IPL 2024 takes place on Thursday, May 9 in Dharamsala, Himachal Pradesh. According to weather reports, the temperature of Dharamsala City on Thursday will be 29\u00b0 Celcius during the day and 21\u00b0 at night.\n\nThe sky will be clear in the morning but partly cloudy at night. The chances of rain are 24% in the day and 10% at night. The humidity will be about 43% to 51% on Thursday.\n\nThe PBKS vs RCB encounter takes place at Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium in Dharamsala. According to stats, HPCA Stadium is a good-scoring ground.\n\nThe stadium has witnessed 11 T20Is, out of which, teams batting first won 4 games while teams batting second won 6 matches. The average 1st and 2nd innings totals at the stadiums are 137 and 128 respectively. The top-ever team total at the stadium is 200/4, posted by South Africa in a match against India.\n\nIn the Indian Premier League, HPCA Stadium has hosted 12 games. The teams batting first won 7 games while the teams batting second won 5 matches. Punjab Kings holds the record for highest-ever IPL total at the stadium with 232/2. The average 1st innings total in IPL is 179.\n\nThe pitch is batting-friendly. Due to high altitude, winds allow a lot of movement and help in swing. Dew also plays a big role here so teams often prefer to chase.\n\nAlso Read: \"Wasn't mentally ready...\" - Dinesh Karthik reveals being forced to bat after RCB's awful collapse vs GT\n\nThe PBKS vs RCB match of IPL 2024 will take place at night. Since the chance of rain is 10% at the time, the encounter will not be affected by rain. However, dew can have a major impact on the encounter.\n\nThe Punjab Kings vs Royal Challengers Bangalore match will not be affected by rain. There are more chances of rain during the morning and afternoon and light rainfall can affect the pitch. However, the Aussie all-rounder has failed to impress once again as he scored 4 off 3 balls in the recent game against GT in Bengaluru. Following this effort, Parthiv Patel called Maxwell the most overrated player in the history of IPL in an explosive tweet.\n\nMaxwell has scored just 36 runs in 8 matches so far in the IPL 2024 campaign. Jitesh has struggled with the bat this season.\n\nRCB have brought in Lockie Ferguson for the game in place of Maxwell and haven't hindered a lot with their winning combination. {"uri": "8119676472", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "19:15:37", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T19:15:37Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T19:15:02Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6509804129600525, "url": "https://www.socialnews.xyz/2024/05/09/ipl-2024-rcb-keep-their-playoffs-hopes-alive-as-pbks-are-eliminated-after-60-run-defeat-ld/", "title": "IPL 2024: RCB keep their Playoffs hopes alive as PBKS are eliminated after 60-run defeat (ld)", "body": "Dharamsala, May 10 (SocialNews.XYZ) Virat Kohli's majestic 92 off 47 balls, coupled with a collective bowling effort helped Royal Challengers Bengaluru get a 60-run win over Punjab Kings in Match 58 of Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 at the HPCA Stadium here on Thursday. The result means RCB keep their Playoff hopes alive with their fourth win on the trot, while PBKS become the second team after Mumbai Indians to be eliminated from the tournament.\n\nKohli hit seven fours and six maximums at a strike rate of 195.74 in his vintage knock which also took him past the 600-run mark in the IPL 2024. He was ably supported by Rajat Patidar's 55, his fourth fifty of this season as RCB posted 241/7, their fourth-highest total in the tournament.\n\nFor PBKS, pacer Harshal Patel took 3-38, taking his IPL 2024 wickets tally to 20, while debutant fast-bowler Vidwath Kaverappa took 2-36, including a terrific Power-play spell, though the hosts were sloppy in their fielding. PBKS had a glimmer of hope to overhaul the total via a 65-run partnership between Jonny Bairstow and Rilee Rossouw. Though Rossouw made 61, none of PBKS's batters stood up as they were bowled out for 181 in 17 overs.\n\nKohli could have been out on the third ball of the innings if Ashutosh Sharma had not dropped a difficult catch at point off Kaverappa. Faf du Plessis got going with back-to-back fours through extra-cover off Kaverappa, who had the last laugh by having the RCB skipper hole out to deep point in the third over. In the same over of Kaverappa, Kohli got another life on 10 when Rilee Rossouw dropped another difficult catch at extra cover. Kohli and Will Jacks hit three boundaries collectively to take 16 runs off Sam Curran in the fourth over before Kaverappa had the latter sweeping to short fine leg.\n\nBut Kaverappa had to see the third catch dropped by PBKS off his bowling, as Patidar's chance was shelled by Harshal Patel at deep fine leg while on zero. Patidar smacked Harshal for three boundaries in a 12-run sixth over, before he and Kohli took a six each in Kaverappa's final over. Patidar stepped up the attack against spinners by smacking Rahul Chahar for three sixes in his first over and was given another life when Jonny Bairstow was late to react to a catch behind. He would get his fifty in 21 balls when he pulled Sam Curran over short fine-leg for six, before nicking behind to keeper off the left-arm pacer.\n\nFollowing a 33-minute rain and hail interruption, Kohli got his fifty in 32 balls with a vintage flick through mid-wicket for four off Liam Livingstone. He continued to nail authoritative boundaries mixed with nonchalance and vintage stroke-play to the delight of fans chanting 'Kohli, Kohli'. But Kohli fell eight runs short of his second century this season when he sliced an Arshdeep Singh delivery to deep third man in the 18th over. Dinesh Karthik hit three quick boundaries before holing out to long-on off Harshal, who castled Mahipal Lomror and had Cameron Green miscuing in the deep on the last ball of the innings.\n\nRCB had a superb start to their defence as Swapnil Singh trapped Prabhsimran Singh lbw on the fourth ball. Bairstow hit four boundaries and a six in his 16-ball 27, before falling to Lockie Ferguson on the second last ball of the powerplay. Rossouw kept PBKS in the hunt by smashing boundaries at will to hit his first fifty of the competition, which he reached by thumping a six over Green's head. After getting some attention from the physio for an injury, Rossouw holed out to long off against Karn Sharma, who went on to castle Jitesh Sharma.\n\nThough Shashank Singh was smashing boundaries, it wasn't enough for PBKS as Liam Livingstone was caught at cover for a duck, off a leading edge against Swapnil. Shashank himself needed attention from the physio for a shoulder injury and was run out by a direct hit fired by Kohli from deep mid-wicket on the very next ball, falling for 19-ball 37. After that, PBKS never recovered as Ashutosh was trapped lbw by Siraj, followed by Ferguson knocking over Sam Curran. Siraj came back to take out the remaining two wickets and finish with 3-43 as RCB managed another clinical win.\n\nBrief scores:\n\nRoyal Challengers Bengaluru 241/7 in 20 overs (Virat Kohli 92, Rajat Patidar 55; Harshal Patel 3-38, Vidwath Kaverappa 2-36) beat Punjab Kings 181 in 17 overs (Rilee Rossouw 61, Shashank Singh 37; Mohammed Siraj 3-43, Swapnil Singh 2-280 by 60 runs", "source": {"uri": The right-hander pointed out his strike rate after scoring 92 runs off 47 balls at 195.74 in an innings featuring six maximums and seven boundaries.\n\nWith the knock, Kohli also surpassed 600 runs this season. The 35-year-old is the leading runscorer in IPL 2024 and holds the Orange Cap holder. He has scored 634 runs in 12 matches at a strike rate of 153.51, including a century and five 50s.\n\nIn the mid-match show, Virat Kohli said:\n\n\"It was important to keep my strike rate up right through the innings (laughs). So, I was just focused on taking the momentum forward for the team.\n\n\"There was a bit of tricky phase when Rajat got, we're three down and then the bit of rain and hail came in, so we had a bit off stop-up momentum. We had to rebuild for about 8-10 balls and then once the base was set, Cameron [Green] got a few boundaries, I thought, yeah, I've to go again.\"\n\nKohli further pointed out the two-paced nature of the pitch but added that RCB have got themselves to a par score:\n\n\"If you saw Faf and me got done for lack of pace from the pitch when Faf got out and my catch [on zero by Ashutosh Sharma in first over] was dropped as well. So, there was a two-paced feel with the new ball.\n\n\"We thought anything over 230 would be a good total here. That was the only mindset. That was a hell of an over from Harshal in the last over otherwise we would've been 250-plus.\"\n\nThis is not the first time that Kohli has shot a dig at commentators with his strike rate jibe in this IPL season. The reaction comes days after former India captain Sunil Gavaskar gave him an indirect reply to his previous message.\n\nMeanwhile, Virat Kohli will now look to continue his purple patch with the bat as RCB aim for a place in the playoffs. {"uri": "8119643102", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "18:45:30", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T18:45:30Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T18:44:59Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6509804129600525, "url": "https://www.cricbuzz.com/cricket-news/130383/kohli-spinners-keep-rcbs-faint-qualification-hopes-alive", "title": "Kohli, spinners keep RCB's faint qualification hopes alive", "body": "Led by Virat Kohli's 47-ball 92, Royal Challengers Bengaluru posted a 60-run win over Punjab Kings in Dharamsala on Thursday, to keep their hopes alive for the team's qualification chances to IPL 2024 playoffs. PBKS meanwhile, stand eliminated on the basis of this result.\n\nHaving posted a record 241 for 6 after they were put in to bat, an all-round effort from the RCB bowlers ensured that PBKS were bundled out in only 17 overs, for 181.\n\nDifference: Middle overs\n\nEven as Punjab Kings kept on track with the required rate through the middle overs, they lost far too many wickets, which left them with far too much to catch up with in the death overs. In the same period, led by half-centuries from Rajat Patidar and Kohli, RCB laid the platform for a death-overs flourish.\n\n- RCB PBKS Score 108/1 89/5 Run-Rate 12.00 9.89 4s/6s 6/6 7/5\n\nRoyal Challengers Bengaluru\n\nPowerplay: The VK Show\n\nPhase score - 56/2 [RR:9.33, 8x4s, 2x6s]\n\nVidwath Kaverappa, on his debut, should have accounted for the dismissal of the RCB's top-4. However, four dropped catches in the powerplay meant that he had only two wickets to his credit - Faf du Plessis and Will Jacks. Generating steep bounce and outswing, he managed to trouble the RCB batters, but a slew of dropped catches gave the visitors repreives as they scored at a fair clip in the first phase.\n\nMiddle: The other VK takes over\n\nPhase score - 108/1 [RR: 12.00., 6x4s, 6x6s]\n\nAfter being troubled early on, Kohli and Patidar took the attack to Kaverappa, slamming the seamer for a couple of sixes soon after the Powerplay. Patidar, who was dropped once again in the eighth over - this time by Jonny Bairstow - smoked three sixes off Rahul Chahar en route to a breezy half-century that set the tone of RCB's innings. After a brief delay due to a hailstorm, Kohli took the assault to the next level in the company of Cameron Green.\n\nDeath: Harshal controls after RCB onslaught\n\nPhase score - 77/4 [RR: 15.40, 7x4s, 8x6s]\n\nKohli pushed his innings to the fifth gear in the final phase of the play. He took the attack to Sam Curran and Arshdeep before the latter's slower one ended his knock eight short of a fabulous century. Dinesh Karthik and Green continued the onslaught before Harshal Patel bowled a tidy final over in which he scalped three wickets and conceded only three runs to ensure RCB didn't breach the 250-run mark.\n\nPunjab Kings\n\nPowerplay: Bairstow, Rossouw power PBKS to strong start\n\nPhase score - 75/2 [RR:12.50, 13x4s, 2x6s]\n\nPunjab Kings were pegged back early with Prabhsimran Singh getting trapped leg before by Swapnil Singh in the first over. They could've had Rilee Roussow dismissed soon after but Mahipal Lomror put down a straightforward chance at backward square leg. The southpaw cashed in on that opportunity and took the attack to Mohammed Siraj in the fourth over, smashing the pacer for 18 runs. Soon after Bairstow also joined the party but was dismissed towards the end of the phase.\n\nMiddle-overs: PBKS stutter against spin\n\nPhase score - 89/5 [RR:9.89, 7x4s, 5x6s]\n\nLed by three strikes by the RCB spinners - Karn Sharma and Swapnil Singh - RCB kept denting PBKS' progress even as their long list of hard hitters continued to keep up with the required rate. To add to it, a terrific diving throw from Kohli to run Shashank Singh out added to the misery of the hosts. Mohammed Siraj ended this phase by trapping Ashutosh Sharma leg-before wicket, leaving Sam Curran to score at more than 15 an over in the death in the company of the lower-order.\n\nDeath: PBKS dismantled\n\nPhase score - 17/3 in 2 overs [RR: 8.50, 3x4s, 0x6s]\n\nLockie Ferguson knocked over Curran, the last possible threat to RCB's total, three balls into the death overs. Siraj broke little sweat to clean up Punjab Kings' tail, as PBKS lost their last three wickets in 12 deliveries to fold well short of the target.\n\nBrief Scores: Royal Challengers Bengaluru 241/7 in 20 overs (Virat Kohli 92, Rajat Patidar 55; Harshal Patel 3-38, Vidwath Kaverappa 2-36) beat Punjab Kings 181 in 17 overs (Rilee Rossouw 61, Shashank Singh 37; Mohammed Siraj 3-37, Swapnil Singh 2-28) by 60 runs\n\nWhat next?\n\nRCB return home and play the first of their two home games against Delhi Capitals on May 12 (Sunday). He put on a blistering 76-run stand with Rajat Patidar, who played a brilliant counter-attacking knock of 55(23), to help set the platform. Cameron Green (46 off 27) and Dinesh Karthik (18 off 7) provided crucial late surge to propel the visitors to a formidable 241/7.\n\nA stupendous catch running backwards from Faf du Plessis, a sensational off-balance direct-hit run out from Kohli and a crucial spell of 2/29 from Karn Sharma led RCB's turnaround as they bowled PBKS out for 181 in 17 overs.\n\nDefending 242, RCB got off to a good start as Swapnil Singh trapped Prabhsimran Singh LBW in the first over. Rilee Rossouw started off well with consecutive fours off his first two balls. RCB could have had Rossouw early but on a day of drops, Faf du Plessis couldn't hold on to a tough chance after Rossouw smashed one to backward point. The PBKS batter made RCB pay as he went berserk against Mohd. Siraj in the next over, smacking three fours and a six. Jonny Bairstow too switched gears as the pair added 65 runs off just 30 balls before Lockie Ferguson broke the partnership in the last over of the Powerplay, having Bairstow caught at mid off. Faf du Plessis plucked a brilliant catch running backwards to break the rampaging stand as PBKS reached 75/2 at the end of the Powerplay.\n\nRossouw, though, went from strength to strength and brought up his fifty off just 21 balls, in style, with a four and a six off Green. With Rossouw going great guns, captain Faf du Plessis called on the in-form Karn Sharma to do the job, and he obliged his skipper, having Rossouw (61 off 27) caught at long on, bouncing back strongly after being hit for a four and a six earlier in the over. It turned the match around. The wily leg-spinner displayed his bounceback ability once again as he cleaned up Impact Player Jitesh Sharma in his next over after being hit for a six and a four earlier in the over. PBKS lost three in quick succession as Swapnil Singh sent back Liam Livingstone for a duck in the next over. Shashank Singh was looking confident in the middle but a sensational fielding effort brought an end to his 37-run knock (off 19 balls) as Kohli's off-balance direct hit found him short. It was another crucial moment in the match.\n\nRCB kept picking up wickets regularly as Mohd. Siraj trapped Ashutosh Sharma LBW and Lockie Ferguson cleaned up captain Sam Curran to reduce PBKS to 170/8. Siraj then finished it off in the 17th over, sending back Harshal Patel and Arshdeep Singh as RCB cruised to a big win.\n\nEarlier, PBKS won the toss and elected to field. Kohli's battle at the other end with Kaverappa was developing into a fascinating one. The RCB batter charged down the track and hit the first ball of the fifth over straight down the ground for a six, but Kaverappa bounced back to have the ominous looking Jacks caught at short fine leg with Harshal Patel pulling off a fine catch. Two balls later, Kaverappa could have had his third wicket when Rajat Patidar swung one uppishly to long leg but to the despair and disappointment of Kaverappan, Harshal dropped an easy chance.\n\nPatidar made Harshal pay for the drop as he hit three fours in his first over, which was the last over of the Powerplay as RCB reached 56/2 at the end of the first six overs. The pair went on a six-hitting spree, hitting five sixes in the next two overs.\n\nBut Patidar got lucky in between, as Jonny Bairstow couldn't hold onto a tough chance after Patidar edged one off Rahul Chahar. But the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) have found a way to stitch together three wins on the trot to lift themselves off the bottom of the points table and keep themselves in the playoff race, mathematically at least.\n\nRCB will be up against the Punjab Kings (PBKS), who are languishing below them in eighth place. Both teams have had ugly campaigns so far, but the HPCA Stadium in Dharamsala will add some beauty to a contest that has had a storied history over the last few years in the IPL.\n\nDuring the reverse fixture, Dinesh Karthik and Mahipal Lomror took advantage of some terrible death bowling from PBKS to take RCB to a memorable win in front of their home crowd. Rahul Chahar and Harpreet Brar have bowled well over the last two games, and Harshal Patel has found his rhythm, but Bengaluru have the tools to counter those styles of bowling.\n\nOn the whole, RCB seem to have more bases covered.
