Having won four games out of 11, PBKS are placed eighth in the IPL 2024 standings. On the other hand, RCB are currently placed seventh in the IPL 2024 standings with eight points on the board after winning four matches out of 11.\n\nAhead of another exciting clash between these teams, we look at the predicted XIs of both sides.\n\nPrabhsimran Singh will open the innings for PBKS in the absence of Shikhar Dhawan. He eventually found his form in IPL 2024 and has scored 251 runs in 11 matches. With a fifty-plus score and strike rate of 156.88 to his name, the right-hander will aim to guide his team to a brisk start on Thursday.\n\nJonny Bairstow's recent batting performances have been remarkable. Sporting an impressive average of 32.13 and a strike rate of 163.69, he has amassed 257 runs in nine matches. The English wicketkeeper-batter has even notched a century in IPL 2024 and will be determined to challenge RCB's bowlers in front of the home crowd.\n\nRilee Rossouw didn't have an ideal beginning to his IPL 2024 journey, but he has steadily found a bit of form. In five matches, Rossouw has accumulated 79 runs, highlighted by a rapid 43-run cameo against CSK. Having scored at a strike rate of 151.92, the South African international will be determined to make a significant impact against RCB in the upcoming fixture on Thursday.\n\nShashank Singh plays a crucial role in the Punjab Kings' batting lineup. With 315 runs in 11 matches, the hard-hitting batter flaunts an outstanding average of 63 and an impressive strike rate of 165.79. He is the team's top-scorer this season and could be a game-changer in their upcoming match against RCB.\n\nIn the absence of the injured Shikhar Dhawan, Sam Curran will assume the role of captaincy. While Curran's batting performances have been average, his bowling has shone brightly, with 13 wickets in 11 IPL 2024 matches. He will be eager to make significant contributions with both bat and ball in the upcoming match.\n\nJitesh Sharma certainly bolsters the Punjab Kings' batting lineup. Despite a subpar performance with the bat in IPL 2024, having amassed only 128 runs in 11 matches, Sharma's capacity to unleash powerful shots could catch the RCB bowling unit off guard come Thursday.\n\nAshutosh Sharma\n\nAshutosh Sharma has enjoyed a sensational debut IPL season. The skilled batter has been formidable, accumulating 162 runs in just eight matches. With a half-century to his name and an impressive strike rate of 172.34, Sharma has shown signs of being a match-winner. If allowed to bat against RCB, he has the potential to amass crucial runs and accelerate the innings for his team.\n\nHarpreet Brar\n\nHarpreet Brar is set to spearhead PBKS' spin bowling attack in the upcoming match. With six wickets to his credit in 11 matches and a decent economy rate of 7.56, Brar has showcased his bowling prowess. Along with taking wickets, he is also handy in containing the opposition batters. Additionally, he possesses batting skills and can contribute crucial runs lower down the order.\n\nRahul Chahar\n\nRahul Chahar will partner with Harpreet Brar in the spin bowling attack. His diverse spin arsenal has the potential to outfox even the most seasoned batters, leading him to claim eight wickets in six matches this season. Chahar heads into this match fresh from a three-wicket performance against CSK and will look to add to his wickets tally against RCB.\n\nHarshal Patel\n\nHarshal Patel is a key figure in the pace bowling department for Punjab Kings. The right-arm pacer is currently the second-highest wicket-taker in the ongoing IPL edition with 17 scalps from 11 matches. His proficiency in delivering deceptive slower balls will be instrumental in both containing batters and securing vital breakthroughs for PBKS.\n\nKagiso Rabada\n\nKagiso Rabada is expected to lead the Punjab Kings' bowling attack on Thursday. His ability to take wickets during the powerplay and maintain accurate lengths has resulted in 11 scalps in 11 matches this season. Rabada will be eager to secure early dismissals and put pressure on RCB.\n\nVirat Kohli heads into this match on the back of a 27-ball 42 runs in his last match against Gujarat Titans. Kohli's innings included two boundaries and four sixes, showcasing a striking rate of 155.56. With a total of 542 runs in just 11 matches this season, he is the leading run-scorer in IPL 2024 and will look to contribute again on Thursday.\n\nFaf du Plessis (captain)\n\nRCB captain Faf du Plessis will open the innings along with Virat Kohli in the upcoming match against PBKS. Faf has been in decent form in IPL 2024 with 352 runs in 11 matches including three fifty-plus scores while maintaining an impressive strike rate of 172.55. The former Proteas captain will be eager to put up a big score in the upcoming match.\n\nWill Jacks\n\nIn IPL 2024, Will Jacks announced himself with a blazing 41-ball ton against GT. With 177 runs in six matches at an average of 35.40 and a strike rate of 186.32, the English batter has been outstanding. Jacks has also contributed with the ball, claiming two wickets for RCB. The hard-hitting English cricketer will be eager to showcase his power-hitting skills at Dharamshala.\n\nRajat Patidar\n\nTalented batter Rajat Patidar is an important member of the RCB lineup. With a strike rate of 178.53, Patidar has scored 213 runs in 11 matches in IPL 2024. He did not bat well in the previous match, but Rajat will be keen to bounce back with a fiery performance sooner rather than later.\n\nGlenn Maxwell\n\nWith only 36 runs in eight matches, Glenn Maxwell has yet to have a successful outing with the bat in IPL 2024. However, the Australian all-rounder has managed to claim five wickets and is capable of taking games away with the bat when in form, making him a key player for RCB.\n\nCameron Green\n\nMaxwell's compatriot Cameron Green adds depth to RCB's batting as well as bowling department. Green has had a below-par performance with the bat this season but has been impressive with the ball in hand. The Australian all-rounder has taken seven wickets in nine matches and will aim to produce an all-round performance against PBKS.\n\nDinesh Karthik (wicketkeeper)\n\nThe addition of Dinesh Karthik to RCB's starting lineup injects crucial firepower into their already lethal batting lineup. In 11 matches, the wicketkeeper-batter has accumulated 283 runs, including two fifty-plus scores. He also boasts an impressive average of 56.60 and a striking rate of 193.84. Karthik will look to make a significant impact and further bolster his run tally in the upcoming match against Punjab.\n\nSwapnil Singh\n\nSwapnil Singh has made a bit of an impact with ball in hand in IPL 2024. The off-spinner's ability to outsmart batters with his spin variations has led to him taking three wickets in three matches. He could lead the spin-bowling attack for RCB and will aim to improve his wicket tally against PBKS come Thursday.\n\nKarn Sharma\n\nKarn Sharma is an important member of the RCB spin-bowling outfit and has scalped four wickets in five matches. However, two quick wickets of Faf du Plessis and Will Jacks shifted the momentum for a time, but as soon as Rajat Patidar came out to bat, things changed rapidly. The 30-year-old smacked 55 runs off 23 runs, which changed the momentum. After he walked back to the pavilion, Kohli took control of the situation and made 92 runs off 47 balls. After he got out, wickets fell like a house of cards as RCB picked up a comfortable win in the end. With the ball, Swapnil Singh and Mohammed Siraj were incredible for RCB.\n\n1. King Kohli reigns supreme\n\nIf you can't stop Virat early, it will be too late in the end. That's what happened in Dharamshala with the Punjab Kings. However, the management kept their faith in Patidar, who is delivering time and again now. Notably, Patidar once again proved that he is the man for RCB in the middle order.\n\n3. PBKS failed to win their previous encounter against RCB in the league and will aim for a victory this time. Below is Punjab Kings predicted playing 11 for IPL 2024 match 58.\n\nPrabhsimran Singh will be the opener for Punjab Kings in the clash against RCB. The right-handed batsman started well in the previous game with his 30 runs. He had added 251 runs in 11 games in IPL 2024.\n\nJonny Bairstow is a powerful batter for Punjab Kings in IPL 2024 and will be the other opener against RCB. However, after RCB raced to 119/3 in 10 overs, the weather gods intervened, forcing a halt in action.\n\nThe loser of this contest will officially be eliminated from playoff contention and the winner needs to win their remaining games along with other results to go their way.\n\nWith the rain interruption, RCB fans were left wondering about their side's chances should the game be abandoned and the points were shared. If the points were shared, the maximum RCB can reach is 13 points at the end of the league stage.\n\nThree teams, Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR), Rajasthan Royals (RR), and SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH), are already on 16, 16 and 14 points, respectively. Unfortunately for RCB, two teams on 12 points, Delhi Capitals (DC) and Lucknow Super Giants (LSG), face off next week, meaning one of the two will reach 14 points.\n\nAs a result, RCB will be eliminated if the ongoing PBKS clash is abandoned and the points are shared. Yet, there is one improbable miracle that RCB fans can hope for should they only grab a point in the PBKS encounter.\n\nIf the DC-LSG clash suffers a similar fate and the match is abandoned, RCB can still garner hopes of qualifying for the playoffs if they win out and the results go against all the other competing teams for the 4th spot.\n\nRCB in a dominant position with the bat against PBKS\n\nRCB were sitting pretty on 119/3 in 10 overs against PBKS when rain stopped play at Dharamsala.\n\nDespite losing skipper Faf du Plessis and the big-hitting Will Jacks for 9 and 12, Virat Kohli raced to 42* off 23 deliveries. The talented Rajat Patidar walked in at No. 4 and smashed a magnificent 55 off 23 before being dismissed by PBKS captain Sam Curran at the stroke of rain.\n\nPBKS were sloppy on the field, dropping several catches, including Kohli's on 0. Kohli crossed the 600-run mark in the 15th over bowled by Liam Livingstone.\n\nIt marked the fourth instance of the champion batter scoring 600-plus runs in an IPL season.\n\nKohli scored 634 runs in the 2013 IPL season, the first time he scaled the 600-run mark. His next 600+ season was the unforgettable 2016 campaign, where he scored the most runs in a single IPL edition with 973 runs. After a few mediocre seasons, King Kohli returned to his best last season and finished with 639 runs in 14 games.\n\nThe veteran cricketer is the IPL's all-time leading run-scorer with 7,897 runs and has won the Orange Cap once in 2016. With only one team out of the playoffs race so far, fans can expect riveting encounters in their remaining matches as nine teams battle it out for the top four spots. Two teams whose playoff chances are hanging by a loose thread namely RCB and PBKS will clash against each other in Match 58 on Thursday, May 09 at Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium, Dharamsala.\n\nAfter winning just two games out of their first eight matches, Punjab have somehow kept their hopes alive with back-to-back wins against KKR and CSK in their ninth and tenth fixtures. However, they failed to beat the defending champions at their home in their second clash which put them in a precarious situation. They find themselves on the eighth spot on the points table with four wins from 11 matches having eight points to their names.\n\nOn the other hand, RCB have also revived their campaign after six consecutive losses with a hat-trick of wins against SRH and GT. The Faf du Plessis-led side began their campaign with a six-wicket loss against southern rivals CSK but went on to win their second clash against PBKS. However, since then, their depleted bowling was badly exposed against some of the fiercest teams in the competition who gave them a run for their money. Courtesy of some heroic performances from individuals, RCB are still alive in the competition and will look to once again beat PBKS in a must-win encounter.\n\nIPL 2024 Full Coverage | IPL 2024 Points Table and Standings | 2024 IPL Full Schedule\n\nRCB registered their first win of the ongoing season against PBKS in their second fixture. The southpaw will remain unavailable in the upcoming fixture as well. On the other hand, RCB have no injury concerns heading into the game and are likely to field the same playing XI as their last fixture.\n\nThere has been just one game played at the venue so far in the tournament where CSK beat PBKS by 28 runs. The surface seemed to be on the slower side as batters found it tough to score against the spinners in the middle overs. Seamers also mixed up their pace to take full advantage of the sluggish pitch. However, the upcoming fixture being a day-night affair, the pitch is expected to be a belter of a track for batters as has been the history in Dharamsala. they kept their chances alive for a top-four finish but knocked Punjab out of the race of the playoffs qualification.\n\nPunjab Kings became the second side after Mumbai Indians to get knocked out of overs whereas Swapnil Singh, Lockie Ferguson and Karn Sharma took two wickets each.\n\nThis was RCB's fifth win of the season as they are placed in the seventh position in the points table with 10 fours and three sixes.\n\nShashank Singh contributed 37 runs in just 19 deliveries before he was undone by a brilliant run out from Virat Kohli in the 14th over.\n\nTheir star opener was dismissed for {"uri": "2024-05-350043848", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "09:52:47", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T09:52:47Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T09:37:20Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6352941393852234, "url": "https://www.sportskeeda.com/cricket/what-happened-last-time-pbks-played-rcb-ipl-match-dharamsala", "title": "What happened the last time PBKS played RCB in an IPL match in Dharamsala?", "body": "The 58th match of the ongoing Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 will witness a clash between the Punjab Kings and the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) at the Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association (HPCA) Stadium in Dharamsala. The two sides will square off on Thursday, May 9.\n\nThe venue has been playing host to IPL matches this year for the first time since 2013. PBKS, after playing their initial home games at the newly built Maharaja Yadavindra Singh Stadium in Mullanpur, Mohali, shifted bases to Dharamsala.\n\nAs the tournament approaches its business end, PBKS are all set to host RCB for their upcoming encounter. The last time these two teams clashed in an IPL match in Dharamsala was way back in 2013, when PBKS (then Kings XI Punjab) was led by Adam Gilchrist and RCB (then Royal Challengers Bangalore) was led by Virat Kohli.\n\nIn that game, the hosts won the toss and opted to put runs on board first. They faced an early setback as Paul Valthaty was dismissed in the powerplay courtesy of Charl Langeveldt. What followed next was absolute carnage by the home skipper and top-order batter Shaun Marsh.\n\nGilchrist and Marsh took the opposition bowlers to the cleaners and went on to notch up their respective half-centuries. Towards the end of the first innings, the former managed to go past the three-figure mark and ended up hitting 106 runs off 55 deliveries before being dismissed on the penultimate ball.\n\nGilchrist's knock included eight fours and nine sixes as he struck at 192.72. Marsh played a beautiful innings as well, and walked back unbeaten scoring 79 off 49, including seven fours and five sixes. Courtesy of the 206-run second-wicket partnership between the Aussie duo, Punjab posted a humungous 232/2 in their allotted 20 overs.\n\nPBKS bowled out RCB for 121 to win by 111 runs\n\nRCB had a horrid start to their chase as the top-order batting unit faltered inside the powerplay and they were reduced to 34/3 in six overs. Punjab bowlers kept picking wickets at regular intervals, with Piyush Chawla acting as the wrecker in chief. The leg spinner picked up a four-wicket haul and registered figures of 4/17 in his four-over quota.\n\nRyan Harris (3 wickets), Shalabh Srivastava (2 wickets), and Valthaty (1) contributed equally well as RCB were held to 121 in 17 overs. As a result, the Adam Gilchrist-led side bagged a massive 111-run win.\n\nIn the ongoing IPL 2024, both PBKS and RCB are vying for a spot in the playoff amid tight competition from several other teams in contention. While the latter are placed eighth, the former are just above them at seventh place. Both teams have eight points from 11 games played so far but RCB have a better NRR as compared to PBKS.\n\nWith the competition increasing with every passing game, RCB and PBKS will have to win all Exploring Punjab Kings and Royal Challengers Bengaluru's last match scorecards in IPL 2024", "body": "Sam Curran's Punjab Kings (PBKS) will take on Faf du Plessis' Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) in Match 58 of the ongoing Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 at HPCA Stadium in Dharamsala on Thursday, May 9. The two teams have four wins in 11 games each and are coming off contrasting performances in the T20 extravaganza. While Punjab lost to Chennai Super Kings, RCB beat Gujarat Titans in their last outing in IPL 2024.\n\nThe two teams have locked horns 32 times in the IPL, with Punjab leading the head-to-head tally against RCB by 17-15. The Faf du Plessis-led side beat PBKS by four wickets in their most recent face-off at M Chinnaswamy Stadium on March 25.\n\nAsked to bat first, Punjab posted 176/6 in 20 overs. Skipper Shikhar Dhawan starred with the bat, scoring 45 runs off 37 balls, including one six and five boundaries. Meanwhile, Jitesh Sharma, Prabhsimran Singh and Sam Curran chipped in in 20s. Shashank Singh provided the late flourish, scoring an unbeaten 21 off eight deliveries.\n\nGlenn Maxwell and Mohammed Siraj starred with the ball for RCB, returning with two wickets apiece. Yash Dayal and Alzarri Joseph shared one wicket each.\n\nIn response, RCB achieved the target with four balls to spare. Virat Kohli top-scored with 77 off 49, smashing two sixes and 11 boundaries. The middle-order flopped but Dinesh Karthik (28* off 10) and Mahipal Lomror (17 off 8) took the team past the finish line.\n\nKagiso Rabada and Harpreet Brar were the leading wicket-takers for PBKS, bagging two wickets apiece. Sam Curran and Harshal Patel also scalped one each.\n\nRCB beat GT by four wickets in their last IPL game at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium on May 4.\n\nAsked to bat first, the Titans were bundled out for 147 in 19.3 overs. Shahrukh Khan top-scored with 37 runs off 24, while Rahul Tewatia and David Miller chipped in with 35 (21) and 30 (20), respectively. The top three - Wriddhiman Saha, captain Shubman Gill, and Sai Sudharsan - departed in single digits.\n\nMohammed Siraj, Yash Dayal and Vijaykumar Vyshak picked up two wickets each for RCB, while Cameron Green and Karn Sharma scalped one apiece.\n\nIn response, RCB captain Faf du Plessis and Virat Kohli provided a promising start by sharing a 92-run partnership for the opening wicket. Faf smashed 64 off 23 featuring three maximums and 10 boundaries. Kohli also looked good for his 42 off 27, including four sixes and two boundaries.\n\nThe visitors were soon reduced to 117/6 as they suffered a middle-order collapse. However, Dinesh Karthik (21 off 12) and Swapnil Singh (15 off nine) stayed unbeaten to take the team over the line.\n\nJoshua Little was the leading wicket-taker for GT, finishing with figures of 4/45, while Noor Ahmad bagged two wickets.\n\nPBKS lost to defending champions CSK by 28 runs in their last IPL game at HPCA Stadium in Dharamsala on May 5.\n\nPut into bat, the Super Kings put up 167/9 in 20 overs. Ravindra Jadeja starred with the bat, scoring 43 off 26, comprising two sixes and three boundaries. Meanwhile, Ruturaj Gaikwad and Daryl Mitchell also chipped in with 32 (21) and 30 (19), respectively.\n\nRahul Chahar and Harshal Patel were the pick of the PBKS bowlers, returning three wickets apiece, while Arshdeep Singh scalped two wickets.\n\nIn response, Punjab managed 139/9. Ravindra Jadeja delivered with the ball, returning with figures of 3/20, while Simarjit Singh and Tushar Deshpande bagged two wickets each. match 58 of the Indian Premier League (IPL) between Punjab Kings and Royal Challengers Bengaluru at the HPCA Stadium in Dharamsala on Thursday, May 9.\n\nKohli smashed 92 runs in just 47 balls on the back of seven fours and six sixes to help RCB post a massive total of 241/7 in their 20 overs.\n\nKohli, who scored at 195.74, ended up taking a dig at the criticism he faced over his strike rate in the IPL 2024.\n\nThe star batter said that it was important for him to maintain his strike rate throughout his knock.\n\nALSO READ: Virat Kohli Breaks Multiple Records During PBKS vs RCB Match Despite Missing Out On Hundred\n\n\"It was important to keep up my strike-rate through the innings so I wanted to take on the momentum,\" Virat Kohli said with a smile on his face during the chat with the broadcasters in the mid-innings break.\n\nNotably, Kohli faced criticism for his strike rate earlier in the IPL 2024 season and the star batter turned down all the talks with his 70-run knock in 44 balls against Gujarat Titans in Ahmedabad.\n\nHe took a dig at the people who make assessments while 'sitting in a box'.\n\nTalking about the knock against Punjab, Kohli explained why he took an aggressive approach against their bowlers in Dharamsala.\n\nKohli might have missed out on his 10th T20 hundred by just 8 runs and received massive applause from the crowd which he acknowledged on his way back to the pavilion.\n\nKohli stitched a crucial partnership of 76 runs for the third wicket with Rajat Patidar before the latter's dismissal in the 10th over who had scored his fifty in just 19 balls.\n\nKohli then took the responsibility into his own hands and led the charge before his own dismissal in the 18th over.\n\n\"It was a tricky phase when Rajat got out, we got three down and the rain came in. So we needed a bit of time to settle but once Cameron and I did, I thought 'I have to go again.' The wicket was a bit two-paced, the ones pitching on the grassy ones were skidding on,\" Kohli said.\n\nALSO READ: KL Rahul Likely To Lead LSG In Last Two Matches Of The Season Amid Captaincy Change Rumours\n\nKohli, who became the first player to go past 600 runs this season, made sure that RCB posted their fourth-highest-ever IPL total.\n\nNotably, the match between RCB and Punjab Kings is a crucial one as the loser of the game will get knocked out of the race to make it to the playoffs.\n\nKohli went past 600 runs for the fourth time in his IPL career, equalling KL Rahul for the most number of 600-plus totals in a season in the tournament.\n\nThe star batter now has 634 runs to his name in 12 matches at an impressive strike-rate of 153.", "source": {"uri": "english.jagran.com", {"uri": "2024-05-350043849", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "09:52:50", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T09:52:50Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T09:32:11Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6235294342041016, "url": "https://www.sportskeeda.com/cricket/3-things-pbks-need-right-beat-rcb-ipl-2024-clash-dharamsala", "title": "3 things PBKS need to do right to beat RCB in IPL 2024 clash in Dharamsala", "body": "A pivotal do-or-die encounter between the Punjab Kings (PBKS) and the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) will thrill IPL fans at the picturesque Dharamsala on May 9.\n\nWith a minimum of seven wins needed to stand a chance for playoff qualification, the loser of this contest will be eliminated, considering both teams are on four wins and seven defeats after 11 outings.\n\nDespite their below-par overall record, both sides have been in impressive form in their recent encounters. RCB have won three consecutive games while PBKS have emerged victorious in two out of their last three.\n\nYet, PBKS had their two-match winning streak broken in their last outing against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) at Dharamsala.\n\nWhile, PBKS still maintains an overall edge of 17-15 against RCB in the IPL, the Bengaluru-based franchise has won the last two meetings, including the one earlier in the season.\n\nA closely contested game saw RCB thrill the home fans with a four-wicket win off the final over.\n\nWith a win being a non-negotiable to avoid an embarrassing 10th consecutive exit before the playoffs, PBKS will look to keep their slim hopes alive against the RCB resurgence.\n\nOn that note, let us look at 3 things PBKS must do to upstage RCB in the IPL 2024 clash in Dharamsala.\n\n#1 Break Virat Kohli's recent love affair with PBKS through Kagiso Rabada\n\nIt is stating the obvious that dismissing Virat Kohli is paramount for a team's chances to win. However, the statement holds more truth than usual for PBKS.\n\nWhile the 35-year-old averages only 33.50 against Punjab in IPL history, the numbers have shot up over the last three seasons. Kohli has averaged a sensational 65.70 at a strike rate of almost 142 in four games since 2022.\n\nFurther evidence of his dominance against PBKS is an average of 68 in RCB's two wins during that period. The champion batter was the Player of the Match in the first meeting between the two sides this season, scoring a 49-ball 77 in a tense run-chase.\n\nKohli is also the leading scorer of IPL 2024 with 542 runs at an average of almost 68 in 11 outings. All this makes dismissing him priority No.1 for the PBKS bowlers.\n\nAce pacer Kagiso Rabada might be their best option to dislodge the RCB stalwart, thanks to his excellent record against Kohli in the IPL. The South African pacer has dismissed Kohli times, with the champion batter averaging only 12 at a strike rate of 112.5 in their IPL duels.\n\nConsidering his death-bowling woes, using Rabada for an extensive spell at the top might be PBKS' best bet to remove Virat Kohli and inch ahead against RCB.\n\n#2 PBKS travel as far as their top order takes them\n\nPBKS' sub-par season thus far has been largely due to their brittle and inconsistent top order. While a T20 game is 40 overs long, the overall performances of the Punjab-based franchise have often mirrored their top order's showing.\n\nJust the last few games is concrete evidence of that, with their wins coming in matches the top order sets the tone. In their latest outing against CSK, PBKS were immediately reduced to 9/2 in two overs and a 28-run defeat followed.\n\nHowever, in their back-to-back wins before the CSK clash, PBKS were off to starts of 83/1 in nine overs and 93/0 in six overs.\n\nThe absence of regular skipper Shikhar Dhawan has hurt PBKS badly at the top, with the side trying numerous options in the opening position, resulting in a lack of stability.\n\nThat Shashank Singh, who batted predominantly in the lower middle order, boasts the best average of 63 among PBKS batters is more the problem than the solution. None of the other specialist batters average 35 this season, adding to PBKS' woes with the willow.\n\nFor them to have a chance of dethroning RCB, the top-order batters must come to the party and deliver the goods.\n\n#3 PBKS spin twins must control the middle overs\n\nAs much as the three-pronged pace attack of Kagiso Rabada, Arshdeep Singh and Harshal Patel hog the limelight, the spin duo of Rahul Chahar and Harpreet Brar have been the difference makers for good and bad in PBKS' IPL 2024 season.\n\nWhile Chahar has eight wickets in six outings, Brar has picked up six scalps in 11 matches this season. However, their averages and economies in PBKS' wins and losses make for a staggering reading.\n\nBrar has conceded runs at an economy of just 6.54 in PBKS' wins and shoots up to almost 8.20 in their losses. Yet, Chahar's massive difference in numbers during victories and defeats makes him the key figure in their bowling attack.\n\nThe leggie has traveled at a dismal economy of 10.12 in PBKS defeats, while just 6.83 in their wins. It is crystal clear that PBKS' performances go as the two spinners bowl in tandem.\n\nThe duo bowling economical spells with control on an uncertain RCB middle-order could be where PBKS assert their domination and seize control of the contest.", "source": {"uri": "sportskeeda.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Sportskeeda"}, "authors": [{"uri": "venkatesh_ravichandran@sportskeeda.com", "name": {"uri": "8119605409", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "18:12:04", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T18:12:04Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T18:11:38Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6235294342041016, "url": "https://news24online.com/sports/ipl-2024-punjab-kings-out-of-playoff-race-after-60-run-defeat-vs-bengaluru/260875/", "title": "IPL 2024: PBKS Out Of Playoff Race After 60-Run Defeat vs RCB", "body": "The win meant that RCB had their playoff hopes alive while Sam Curran and Co. will only be playing for pride as they became the 2nd side to mathematically out of the playoff spots.\n\nMatch 58 of the Indian Premier League (IPL 2024) saw the home side Punjab Kings end their playoff hopes as the Royal Challengers Bengaluru cruised to a 60-run victory in a must-win encounter in Dharamsala on May 9.\n\nChoosing to bat first, RCB captain Faf du Plessis couldn't replicate his explosive opening partnership with Virat Kohli in the powerplay, departing after scoring just 9 runs. However, Kohli remained strong at the crease.\n\nWill Jacks, who played a pivotal role in RCB's recent victory, only contributed 12 runs this time. Rajat Patidar stepped up, forging a robust 76-run partnership with Kohli, propelling the team from 43/2 to 119/3 within the first 10 overs.\n\nPunjab Kings' fielding performance was lackluster, as they dropped several catches that could have saved crucial runs. Despite being dropped by Ashutosh Sharma at 0 and 10 respectively, Kohli capitalized on his chances, scoring a brilliant 92 and extending his lead in the race for the orange cap.\n\nDebutant Vidwath Kaverappa made an impression by taking 2 early wickets, dismissing both Faf du Plessis and Will Jacks. His delivery to Kohli also posed a threat, but the skipper managed to survive and capitalize on the opportunity.\n\nKohli and Cameron Green built another substantial partnership of 92 runs, guiding RCB to a competitive total of 241/7 in their allotted 20 overs as they aim to maintain their momentum in the tournament.\n\nIn reply, it wasn't a pleasant start to the chase for Punjab as they lost opener Prabhsimran Singh in the first over at just 6 runs courtesy of a Swapnil Singh delivery. It was Prabh's opening partner Jonny Bairstow and Rilee Rossouw who started to put the pressure back on RCB with a 65-run partnership but failed to extend it further into the game.\n\nRossouw's 27-ball 61 did give PBKS a reasonable total to chase format the 9-over mark. However, he remained the top scorer for the hosts on the night as 2 quick wickets each by spinners Karn Sharma and Swapnil Singh helped RCB restrict them to just 181 in the end.\n\nPacers Mohd Siraj and Lockie Ferguson also took 3 and 2 wickets respectively in what was a brilliant bowling display by the visitors.\n\nThe win meant that RCB had their playoff hopes alive while Sam Curran and Co. {"uri": "8119672265", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "19:11:47", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T19:11:47Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T19:11:13Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6196078658103943, "url": "https://www.aninews.in/news/sports/cricket/i-know-i-need-to-take-risks-rcbs-virat-following-win-over-pbks20240510003635/", "title": "\"I know I need to take risks...\": RCB's Virat following win over PBKS", "body": "Dharamsala (Himachal Pradesh) [India], May 10 (ANI): Following his side's 60-run win against Punjab Kings (PBKS), in which he played a match-winning knock of 92 runs, Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) batter Virat Kohli said that he was looking to take more risks with his batting and played slog-sweep frequently against spinners just like he used to do in the past. He also said that at this stage of his career, the quality of his game and batting matters more over his runs.\n\nA fine half-century by Rilee Rossouw went in vain as Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) bowlers delivered a brilliant performance to bundle out Punjab Kings (PBKS) for just 181 runs and secure a 60-run win at Dharamsala on Thursday.\n\nSpeaking in the post-match presentation, Virat said, \"Still quality over quantity. More so at this stage of my career. Understanding your game over so many years allows you to practice but still stay switched on. And still aiming to improve aspects of your game that you want to get better on. I brought out the slog-sweep to the spinners. I know I can hit it as I have done it in the past. I know I need to take risks. It takes more conviction to remove the thought 'What if I get out?'.\"\n\n\"I am trying to keep up with the strike rate for me and the team. The only way to go through a tournament is to be honest with ourselves. We had those losses on the trot, we just had a honest conversation. We needed to pull up our socks. That game against KKR went down to the wire. We wanted to play for our self-respect. We just can't go out there and play in such a way and disappoint our fans. The confidence is back and we are on a roll. We have to depend on several other factors (for playoffs qualification),\" he added.\n\nComing to the game, PBKS opted to field first after winning the toss. After the dismissal of skipper Faf Du Plessis (9) and Will Jacks (12) early, Virat (92 in 47 balls, with seven fours and six sixes) and Rajat Patidar (55 in 23 balls, with three fours and six sixes) steadied the RCB's ship with a 76-run stand, keeping the strike rate high. Then, a fine knock by Cameron Green (46 in 27 balls, with five fours and a six) and his 92-run stand with Virat powered RCB to 241/7 in their 20 overs.\n\nHarshal Patel (3/38) was the pick of the bowlers for PBKS. Vidwath Kaverappa (2/36) also did fine on his debut.\n\nIn the run-chase of 242 runs, Rilee Rossouw (61 in 27 balls, with nine fours and three sixes), Shashank Singh (37 in 19 balls, with four boundaries and two sixes) and Jonny Bairstow (27 in 16 balls, with four boundaries and a six) looked dangerous, but lost their wickets on crucial stages.\n\nThe rest of the batters could not really put up a fight and lost the game by 60 runs as PBKS bundled out for 181 runs.\n\nMohammed Siraj was the top bowler for RCB with 3/43. Karn Sharma, Lockie Ferguson and Swapnil Singh also took two wickets. Virat got the Player of the Match award. {"uri": "8119678766", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "19:17:45", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T19:17:45Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T19:17:02Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6196078658103943, "url": "https://www.khaleejtimes.com/sports/cricket/ipl-2024-kohli-knock-keeps-bengaluru-in-the-hunt", "title": "IPL 2024: Kohli knock keeps Bengaluru in the hunt", "body": "Royal Challengers Bengaluru's Virat Kohli plays a shot during the IPL match against Punjab Kings. -- AFP\n\nVirat Kohli slammed 92 to set up a 60-run win for Royal Challengers Bengaluru over Punjab Kings and keep their slim playoff hopes alive in the Indian Premier League on Thursday.\n\nKohli, 35, rode his luck and shared two crucial partnerships with Rajat Patidar (55) and Cameron Green (46) as Bengaluru scored a big 241-7 at the Dharamsala stadium.\n\nPunjab paid the price for some sloppy fielding, dropping Kohli twice on zero and 10 off debutant seamer Vidwath Kaverappa.\n\nPunjab suffered their eighth loss in 12 games and bowed out of the competition.\n\nPunjab skipper Sam Curran said it had been a \"frustrating and disappointing\" end to their campaign.\n\n\"A lot of positive signs but not enough to get over the line and get the wins we needed. Gutted but lots to learn.\"\n\nBengaluru bowler Swapnil Singh, who took two wickets, said the victory meant a lot to the side.\n\n\"Enjoyed it a lot. The ball was swinging initially, so I looked to swing it. Pressure is less when everybody is (scoring) runs. Mentally it relaxes you,\" he said.\n\nRilee Rossouw gave Punjab a promising start, putting on 65 runs for the second wicket with Jonny Bairstow (27).\n\nRossouw, who belted his first half-century of the season, looked set for a bigger score but took a hit on his chin and was out the next ball off Karn Sharma for 61.\n\nHe hit three sixes and nine fours in his 27-ball innings.\n\nAfter Rossouw's dismissal in the ninth over, none of the Punjab batsmen could stand up to the challenge, with the team being bowled out for 181 in 17 overs.\n\nEarlier, Kohli stitched a 76-run partnership with Patidar for the third wicket after Bengaluru were put in to bat.\n\nPatidar looked in fine touch, hitting six sixes and three fours before being caught behind off Curran.\n\nThe leading run-getter of the season, Kohli went on to play some delectable shots including an imperious one-handed six over long off.\n\nKohli also put on 92 runs with Green but fell short of a century after he was caught at deep extra cover off Arshdeep Singh.\n\nHe smashed six sixes and seven fours during his 47-ball 92 at a strike rate of 196.\n\n\"Still quality over quantity. More so at this stage of my career. Understanding your game over so many years allows you to practise but still stay switched on,\" Kohli said.\n\n\"And still aiming to improve aspects of your game that you want to get batter on. I brought out the slog-sweep to the spinners. I know I can hit it as I've done it in the past. I know I need to take risks. Takes more conviction and to remove the thought 'what if I get out?' Means I can improve my strike rate in the middle overs.\"\n\nBengaluru, who registered their fourth win in a row, saw their innings being interrupted briefly by a spell of rain and hailstorm.\n\nBrief scores:\n\nRoyal Challengers Bengaluru beat Punjab Kings by 60 runs.\n\nRoyal Challengers Bengaluru 241/7 oin 20 overs (Virat Kohli 92, Rajat Patidar 55, Cameron Green 46; Harshal Patel The Faf du Plessis-led side secured a comfortable 60-run win over the Punjab Kings (PBKS) in Dharamshala on Thursday, May 9.\n\nRCB posted a mammoth score of 241-7 after being put into bat first by PBKS skipper Sam Curran. Virat Kohli led from the front with a brilliant 92 and was aided by quickfire innings from Rajat Patidar and Cameron Green towards the end. This marked the highest score at the venue when it came to the shortest format.\n\nPBKS made a bright start to the run chase courtesy of Jonny Bairstow and Rille Rossouw. But the steep required rate showed its impact as they began to lose wickets at regular intervals, and could only muster 181 runs before being all out. The defeat officially eliminates PBKS from the playoff race.\n\nFans reacted to RCB still somehow being in contention after losing seven of their first eight matches this season. Here are some of the reactions on Twitter:\n\n\"This RCB with nothing to lose mindset is more dangerous than CSK MI and SRH combined,\" one fan remarked\n\n\"973 would've actually been within reach if RCB had qualified,\" one tweet read\n\n\"4 consecutive wins feels so weird as an rcb fan, hardly been there,\" another tweet read\n\n\"The boys have shown character to turn it around\" - RCB skipper Faf du Plessis\n\nRCB's winning streak began with a win over their Southern rivals, Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH). Following that, they completed the double over the Gujarat Titans (GT) and now completed the double over the Punjab Kings (PBKS). They had already won the reverse fixture in Bengaluru earlier this season.\n\n\" Yeah it was a really good game. Scoring 240 after losing the toss. The method and the aggression is really good to see. We have had some conversations as we felt we were making the same mistakes over and over again. The aggression with the bat was something we wanted to change. You can't just play normal T20 cricket these days,\" Du Plessis said during the post-match presentation.\n\n\"We spoke about how to get more wickets in the powerplay. We challenged a few members. We went to different resources which have worked pretty well. I think you understand that you need some form. The way we started, we have a few guys were looking for runs. You need guys with character to turn it around,\" Du Plessis added.\n\nRCB are scheduled to play their next game against the Delhi Capitals (DC) on Sunday, May 12 at the Chinnaswamy Stadium.", {"uri": "8117861844", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "18:02:42", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T18:02:42Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T18:02:22Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.615686297416687, "url": "https://technosports.co.in/ipl-2024-pbks-vs-rcb-preview-prediction-fantasy/", "title": "IPL 2024: PBKS vs RCB - Preview, Prediction, Team, Fantasy", "body": "Punjab Kings (PBKS) are set to continue their IPL (Indian Premier League) 2024 journey as they clash with Royal Challengers Bengaluru.\n\nThis encounter is scheduled to take place at the Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium, Dharamsala, marking the 58th game of the tournament on Thursday, May 9.\n\nRead More: AFC Confirms Odisha FC's Participation In The Inaugural AFC Women's Champions League 2024/25\n\nThis year's IPL has been fiercely competitive, with no team officially eliminated as the league stage nears its end. Even Mumbai Indians, with just four wins from 12 games, still have a slim chance, albeit a complex one. Historically, 16 points have often secured a playoff spot, but with the league expanding to ten teams, this threshold is no longer reliable. Consequently, teams like KKR and RR, despite sitting on 16 points, cannot afford to relax. On the other hand, PBKS and RCB can only reach a maximum of 14 points, meaning they heavily rely on other results for qualification.\n\nIn this high-stakes scenario, PBKS and RCB meet in Dharamsala for what is essentially a do-or-die encounter, with the loser joining Mumbai Indians in a position where they can only achieve a maximum of 12 points. This match epitomizes the divergent paths these two teams have taken leading up to this crucial game. Although Punjab Kings have only secured four wins from 11 games so far, the results fail to capture how close they were to victory in many of their seven defeats. While top-order collapses have been a recurring issue, concerns also linger over their death bowling in other losses.\n\nAt present, Punjab occupies the eighth position in the standings, having secured four victories and suffered seven defeats. Their aim is to clinch a triumph against RCB to climb higher in the IPL 2024 leaderboard.\n\nRCB's performance has undergone a significant transformation between their initial six matches and their recent five encounters.\n\nTheir batting lineup has notably improved since their loss to Sunrisers Hyderabad by a narrow 25-run margin in a chase of 288. In their last five games, RCB's lowest total was 152, achieved while chasing 148 against Gujarat Titans in Bengaluru. The resurgence can be attributed to Faf du Plessis returning to form and a consistent top four comprising Virat Kohli, du Plessis, Will Jacks, and Rajat Patidar.\n\nDu Plessis has recorded two half-centuries in the last five matches, leading to a quicker run-scoring rate in the initial six overs. RCB's run rate during the powerplay in the last five matches (12.3) significantly surpasses that of the first six games (8.27). This allows players like Jacks and Patidar to bat during the middle overs, as the additional risks taken early on have often resulted in wickets but have ultimately favored RCB, evident in their improved run rate. With more proficient spin-hitters at the crease, RCB's run rate during the middle overs since April 15 has increased to 11.03 compared to 8.41 in the earlier games.\n\nAnother consequence of this batting revival is that Kohli, who has been consistently performing throughout IPL 2024, now has the freedom to play more aggressively, as indicated by the rise in his strike rate from 141.77 in the first six games to 158.15 in the last five matches. This all contributes to why the upcoming match against PBKS might be arriving at an opportune moment for RCB.\n\nOn the contrary, Royal Challengers Bengaluru appears to have regained momentum. With four wins and seven losses in 11 matches, RCB currently holds the seventh spot in the standings. They aspire to extend their winning streak and secure their fourth consecutive victory of the season.\n\nThe recent absence of pressure, as suggested by Faf in post-match presentations, might have contributed to RCB's resurgence. With qualification prospects appearing slim, RCB has played with greater freedom, particularly in their batting displays. Faf's resurgence in form, coupled with the addition of Will Jacks, has injected vigor into the batting order. Moreover, the bowling unit, previously lacking direction and discipline, has shown improvement in their strategies over the last three games.\n\nIn the unpredictable realm of T20 cricket, the differing trajectories of both teams hold little significance as they find themselves in similar situations. While not officially labeled as such, this match effectively serves as a knockout encounter for both teams.\n\nPBKS have demonstrated their prowess as formidable travelers, yet their performances at home haven't been as reassuring. Over the last two seasons, they've had three home venues - Mohali, Dharamsala, and the recent addition, Mullanpur - the highest number among all teams. In IPL 2024, while they've secured victories in three out of five away games, they've only managed to win one out of six matches at home. This places PBKS with the lowest percentage of home wins over the past two seasons, and their upcoming clash against RCB marks their final match in Dharamsala for IPL 2024.\n\nPunjab's aggressive batting approach led to an astonishing run chase against table-toppers KKR, resulting in the highest T20 chase ever witnessed. Much of their batting reliance has been on younger players like Shashank Singh and Ashutosh Sharma, who had to shoulder the burden after early setbacks. While both have showcased their talent, particularly Shashank, it was the return to form of Jonny Bairstow that truly bolstered Punjab's lineup. Following their remarkable triumph over KKR at Eden Gardens, they delivered another memorable win against CSK at Chepauk. However, the subsequent loss to the defending champions at Dharamsala dented Punjab's aspirations. Despite possessing a skilled roster, their ability to handle pressure will ultimately determine their fate.\n\nPBKS now face the challenge of confronting an RCB squad riding a three-match winning streak. Often considered the IPL's perennial underdogs, RCB had a solitary win in their first eight games, seemingly destined for an early exit. However, Faf du Plessis' team turned the tide with consecutive victories, starting with an upset over Sunrisers Hyderabad followed by two convincing wins over Gujarat Titans. These triumphs, characterized by dominant performances, have breathed new life into the team.\n\nAs the race for playoffs intensifies, a defeat for either team would significantly increase the pressure, pushing them closer to elimination.\n\nThe HPCA stadium in Dharamsala typically favors the bowlers, particularly the pacers who can extract movement from the surface. Therefore, a low-scoring match is anticipated. Opting to bowl first and restricting the opposition to a below-par total could prove to be a strategic advantage.\n\nIn the three IPL matches held at Dharamsala since last year, teams winning the toss have predominantly chosen to bowl first, yet only once has this decision translated into a victory. Even in PBKS' previous match at the venue this season, Chennai Super Kings effectively defended a total of 167 runs. The temperature in Dharamsala is expected to be in the early twenties.\n\nThe first game of the season witnessed a slower surface, offering assistance to seamers early on and spinners later in the innings. However, since that was a day game, the venue historically tends to provide better conditions for batsmen during night matches. Nevertheless, there should still be some assistance for pacers with the new ball.\n\nIn the Punjab Kings camp, Shikhar Dhawan's absence due to non-travel leaves the team likely unchanged from their recent successful outings. This means they will probably maintain their current combination, with Jonny Bairstow set to play a pivotal role, especially considering his exceptional track record against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB). Bairstow's history against RCB is remarkable, featuring a century and two fifties in just five innings, accumulating 261 runs at an impressive strike rate of 177.55.\n\nNotably, he also boasts a commanding strike rate of 216 against RCB's powerplay specialist Mohammed Siraj, having scored 54 runs off 25 balls with one dismissal. Punjab Kings will heavily rely on Bairstow's consistent performances against RCB to provide them with a strong start and lay a solid foundation for their innings. While there's a slight possibility of Liam Livingstone's return, it seems improbable given their recent success with the current lineup.\n\nFor Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB), Glenn Maxwell's recent return to action saw him contribute with a wicket in their victory over Gujarat Titans in Ahmedabad, although he didn't get a chance to bat. However, in the subsequent fixture, he faced disappointment with a duck, continuing his lean patch. RCB faces a decision whether to persist with Maxwell or introduce Reece Topley and his varied bowling options, particularly on a surface that offered assistance to slower bowlers in the previous PBKS-CSK match. Additionally, there's a possibility of a swap between impact players Rajat Patidar and Yash Dayal.\n\nRajat Patidar has displayed an aggressive intent between overs 7-15, boasting a striking rate of 183. Despite this, he has also been dismissed seven times in 100 deliveries. His approach against spin will be crucial for RCB, especially considering the form of Punjab's spin duo, Rahul Chahar and Harpreet Brar. Given RCB's current three-match winning streak, it's unlikely for them to make significant changes to their lineup, thus maintaining consistency.\n\nIn the previous encounter between PBKS and RCB, Harpreet Brar emerged as Punjab's most economical bowler, producing outstanding figures of 2 for 13. Despite RCB's aggressive run rate, Brar managed to dismiss key players like Rajat Patidar and Glenn Maxwell. However, RCB's failure to post a challenging total undermined the impact of Brar's performance. Interestingly, RCB has struggled against left-arm orthodox spinners in IPL 2024, scoring slower than any other team except Gujarat Titans. With one-third of his 24 IPL wickets coming against RCB, Brar poses a significant threat to their playoff aspirations.\n\nBefore making his IPL debut, Will Jacks predominantly played as an opener in T20 cricket, with 131 of his 155 innings coming in that role. However, since joining RCB, he has been assigned the No. 3 position and has shown glimpses of promise despite mixed returns. While four of his six innings have yielded single-digit scores, he has also notched up a brilliant 55 and an unbeaten century. Against a formidable bowling attack, which has been the second-most economical in the first 16 overs of matches (powerplay and middle overs) and the most economical in the first ten overs in IPL 2024, {"uri": "8119638424", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "18:41:35", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T18:41:35Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T18:41:01Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6117647290229797, "url": "https://newsable.asianetnews.com/cricket-sports/cricket-ipl-2024-rcb-with-a-crushing-60-run-victory-over-punjab-kings-to-stay-alive-in-season-osf-sd8edv", "title": "IPL 2024: RCB with a crushing 60-run victory over Punjab Kings to stay alive in the season", "body": "Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) delivered a commanding performance to defeat Punjab Kings in the IPL 2024 match, keeping their tournament hopes alive. Despite early hiccups, RCB posted a formidable total, led by Virat Kohli's explosive batting. In response, Punjab Kings faltered, collapsing under RCB's relentless bowling attack.\n\nPunjab Kings are the second team, after Mumbai Indians, to be eliminated from IPL 2024! Royal Challengers Bengaluru keep their tournament hopes alive with a dominant 60-run victory at Dharamsala. In the evening clash, Punjab Kings won the toss and chose to field first. Debutant Vidhwath Kaverappa impressed with his bowling, despite three dropped catches and Virat Kohli's survival on two occasions. Kaverappa claimed the wickets of Faf du Plessis and Will Jacks, finishing with 2/36.\n\nCapitalising on the dropped chances, Kohli led an aggressive charge, supported by Rajat Patidar's explosive half-century off just 21 balls. The duo shared a crucial 76-run partnership before Patidar's dismissal by Sam Curran halted play briefly due to a hailstorm.\n\nKohli continued his stellar form, smashing 92 off 47 balls, including 7 fours and 6 sixes, in a partnership of 92 runs with Cameron Green. Harshal Patel's late flurry and Dinesh Karthik's cameo propelled RCB to 241/7, the highest T20 score at Dharamsala.\n\nIn response, Punjab Kings lost early wickets despite a promising start from Jonny Bairstow and Rilee Rossouw. Rossouw's half-century and Shashank Singh's brisk knock were not enough as RCB spinners led by Swapnil Singh and Karn Sharma struck crucial blows.\n\nVirat Kohli's brilliant run-out of Shashank Singh epitomised RCB's fielding effort. Whereas RCB has managed to win 15 times in the past. Though Punjab have failed to beat RCB in their last two meetings.\n\nBoth the teams have 8 points after playing eleven games this season. After starting the campaign with a victory over DC, Punjab failed to continue the winning streak.\n\nIn their last three matches, they beat CSK and KKR and made the record for the highest-ever successful run-chase in the history of T20 cricket. RCB also made a huge comeback with three successive wins after losing six matches in a row.\n\nIPL 2024 PBKS vs RCB: Bowling Squad Comparison\n\nPunjab have a pacer-heavy squad in this season. Arshdeep Singh, Kagiso Rabada, and Harshal Patel all remain expensive despite getting wickets regularly. In the spin department, Rahul Chahar and Harpreet Brar are in decent form. Chahar picked six wickets in his last three matches.\n\nFor RCB, it was always the batters who got all the limelight. A highly batting-heavy team throughout their history maintained their reputation. Yash Dayal, Mohammed Siraj and Cameron Green are the only bowlers from RCB in the top 50 wicket-takers list of the season. Karn Sharma and Vijaykumar Vyshak will be the most probable spinner options for the Bengaluru side.\n\nIPL 2024 PBKS vs RCB: Who Will be the Top Four Wicket-takers in Match 58?\n\nHarshal Patel (PBKS): The Indian right-arm medium-fast bowler is in the second position in the race for the Purple Cap with 17 wickets. The 33-year-old, despite leaking too many runs, has been able to get wickets in the slog overs. He has 11 wickets only from the slog overs. Against the powerful RCB batting line-up, his skill will be important for Punjab.\n\nArshdeep Singh (PBKS): The 25-year-old youngster is the second-highest wicket-taker for Punjab with 15 wickets. The left-arm medium-fast bowler can be crucial against the heavily right-handed RCB batting line-up. along with skipper Sam Curran, it will be a challenge for him to get an early breakthrough during the powerplay overs.\n\nYash Dayal (RCB): With 10 wickets in 10 matches the 26-year-old is a key element in the RCB's sudden comeback. After a below-average start to the season, the left-arm medium-fast bowler has been brilliant in the last few matches. A few early wickets from the Punjab top-order can be detrimental for the host, and for this, the Challengers will be highly dependent on him.\n\nMohammed Siraj (RCB): The 30-year-old right-arm medium-fast bowler is yet to shine up in this IPL. With only 8 wickets so far, Siraj is the only seasoned pacer in the squad. It is high time for him to step up for the team. As he is selected to represent India in T20 WC 2024, a good performance from him will be hoped for.\n\nFor both the teams all the matches are now final. {"uri": "8119670031", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "19:09:41", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T19:09:41Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T19:09:17Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6117647290229797, "url": "https://www.tbsnews.net/sports/kohli-masterclass-sets-massive-win-bengaluru-punjab-knocked-out-847326", "title": "Kohli masterclass sets up massive win for Bengaluru as Punjab knocked", "body": "Virat Kohli hit 92 off 47 before brilliantly running out Punjab Kings' Shashank Singh to keep RCB in playoffs hunts.\n\nVirat Kohli has eight IPL hundreds to his name. But rarely has an almost-hundred been so devastating. Laced with six sixes and seven boundaries, 92 off 47 balls was exactly the kind of platform RCB needed to pile up 241/7 against Punjab Kings at Dharamsala before their bowlers held their nerve to close out a 60-run win and stay in the hunt for the playoffs.\n\nBut Kohli shouldn't have even opened his account. Ashutosh Sharma had ample time to get into a good position after Kohli's miscued hoick off Vidwath Kaverappa sent the ball swirling in the air. But he barely got a hand to it.\n\nGiven a life, Kohli made the most of it as RCB scored 119 in the first 10 overs and 122 in the next 10 after a rain-forced break. Kohli paced his innings like only he can -- his first two sixes coming in the initial 6.1 overs before taking the aerial route again from the 15th over. If his fifty came in 32 balls, the next 42 came off 15.\n\n\"It was important for me to keep up the strike rate right through,\" Kohli told the broadcasters during the innings break. \"There was a two-paced feel with the new ball. We thought anything over 230 would be a good total here. That was the only mindset.\"\n\nAt that stage of the tournament where points alone may not carry a team through to the IPL playoffs, strike rate has assumed critical importance. RCB didn't skimp on that front. If Kohli's strike rate of 195.74 was exhilarating, simply mindblowing was the way Rajat Patidar dismantled Punjab Kings' bowling with a 23-ball 55. Also dropped on zero, Patidar carted six sixes -- half of them off Rahul Chahar -- as RCB rode a 27-ball 46 from Cameron Green and a seven-ball 18 from Dinesh Karthik to score their fourth-highest IPL total, and their highest away from home.\n\nPressed to maintain a rate of over 12 runs, Punjab Kings landed their share of punches too as they raced to 100 in just 8.2 overs. Rilee Rossouw was responsible for this momentum, picking apart Mohammed Siraj for 4,4,4,6 in the fourth over after he too was dropped by Mahipal Lomror at backward point in the previous over.\n\nBut Rossouw's luck ultimately ran out in the ninth over when pulled Karn Sharma to Will Jacks at long-on. They have the winning momentum on their side, having won their last three games comprehensively.\n\nADVERTISEMENT\n\nThe wins have not only boosted their sagging morale but also taken them to the seventh spot in the points table.\n\nAlso Read: The plan was to keep one over of Kuldeep to counter Ferreira and Powell: Pant\n\nWith eight points from 11 games, RCB can still make the Playoffs if they win all their remaining three fixtures, although the chances are slim.\n\nPunjab Kings, led by Sam Curran, too stare at a similar situation. Kohli and Patidar capitalized on missed opportunities to put on a quick 72-run partnership. Green's 46 also contributed to RCB's strong total. Vidhwath Kaverappa, on his IPL debut, took two early wickets, but his figures were hampered by dropped catches. Kohli's blistering innings and Patidar's six sixes gave RCB the momentum before rain interrupted the match. After resumption, Kohli and Green continued their onslaught to propel RCB past 200.\n\nA classic 47-ball 92 by Virat Kohli and Rajat Patidar's breezy fifty powered Royal Challengers Bengaluru to 241/7 against Punjab Kings in a rain-interrupted IPL match here on Thursday.\n\nThe butterfingered Punjab fielders were guilty of dropping catches as Kohli and Patidar capitalised on the reprieves to put on 72 off 32 balls after they were invited to bat.\n\nKohli, who was dropped on 0 and 10, made PBKS pay as he timed the ball nicely, used his feet and wrists to bring up his sixth IPL fifty this season.\n\nPatidar, who was also given two lives, provided the early momentum as he slammed six maximums and three fours during his 23-ball 55. Kohli and Cameron Green (46 off 27 balls) continued the onslaught, adding 92 runs off 46 balls to take RCB across the 200-mark.\n\nGreen hit five fours and a six before being caught in the final ball of the innings as RCB scored 77 in last five overs.\n\nPacer Vidhwath Kaverappa (2/36) picked up two wickets in the powerplay on his IPL debut but his figures could have been much better had the fielders not dropped three catches off his bowling.\n\nKohli was dropped in the third ball but Kaverappa dismissed Faf du Plessis (9) in his second over to give Punjab the first breakthrough. The IPL debutant could have had Kohli again had Rilee Rossouw held on to a screamer.\n\nPBKS, however, couldn't create pressure as Sam Curran (1/50) conceded 16 runs, which included two fours and a six, with Will Jacks doing the maximum damage.\n\nKohli smashed Kaverappa for a six over long-off, but the bowler removed Jacks at the other end, with Harshal Patel (3/38) taking the catch for his second wicket.\n\nPatel, however, dropped Patidar and then conceded three boundaries while bowling as RCB scored 56 in the powerplay.\n\nIt started raining sixes thereafter as Kohli and Patidar slammed a maximum each to spoil Kaverappa's bowling figures.\n\nPatidar then creamed spinner Rahul Chahar for three mighty maximums before depositing Arshdeep and Sam Curran for two more sixes, the last one bringing up his fifty in 21 balls.\n\nWith Patidar on fire, RCB crossed 100 in the ninth overs. The Punjab skipper, however, got rid off Patidar in the 10th over with Jonny Bairstow holding on to an edge as RCB reached 119/3.\n\nRain briefly interrupted play as the spin duo of Liam Livingstone and Chahar bowled tidy overs after resumption. Kohli completed his fifty in 32 balls and hit Livingstone for two fours.\n\nGreen brought up the 150 with a four off Patel. Kohli then went berserk as he slog swept Livingstone for a six, while Curran was deposited over mid-wicket for a 94-metre maximum. {"uri": "8119511536", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "16:56:19", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T16:56:19Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T16:55:31Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6039215922355652, "url": "https://www.latestly.com/agency-news/sports-news-classic-kohli-patidar-power-rcb-to-241-7-5953185.html", "title": "Sports News | Classic Kohli, Patidar Power RCB to 241-7 | LatestLY", "body": "Get latest articles and stories on Sports at LatestLY. A classic 47-ball 92 by Virat Kohli and Rajat Patidar's breezy fifty powered Royal Challengers Bengaluru to 241/7 against Punjab Kings in a rain-interrupted IPL match here on Thursday.\n\nDharamsala, May 9 (PTI) A classic 47-ball 92 by Virat Kohli and Rajat Patidar's breezy fifty powered Royal Challengers Bengaluru to 241/7 against Punjab Kings in a rain-interrupted IPL match here on Thursday.\n\nThe butterfingered Punjab fielders were guilty of dropping catches as Kohli and Patidar capitalised on the reprieves to put on 72 off 32 balls after they were invited to bat.\n\nAlso Read | ICC T20 World Cup 2024 All Squads: Full Players List of All Teams for Ninth Edition of Men's Twenty20 Cricket WC.\n\nKohli, who was dropped on 0 and 10, made PBKS pay as he timed the ball nicely, used his feet and wrists to bring up his sixth IPL fifty this season.\n\nPatidar, who was also given two lives, provided the early momentum as he slammed six maximums and three fours during his 23-ball 55.\n\nAlso Read | KL Rahul To Resign As LSG Captain? Three Players Who Could Replace the Current Skipper for Remaining IPL 2024 Matches.\n\nKohli and Cameron Green (46 off 27 balls) continued the onslaught, adding 92 runs off 46 balls to take RCB across the 200-mark.\n\nGreen hit five fours and a six before being caught in the final ball of the innings as RCB scored 77 in last five overs.\n\nPacer Vidhwath Kaverappa (2/36) picked up two wickets in the powerplay on his IPL debut but his figures could have been much better had the fielders not dropped three catches off his bowling.\n\nKohli was dropped in the third ball but Kaverappa dismissed Faf du Plessis (9) in his second over to give Punjab the first breakthrough. The IPL debutant could have had Kohli again had Rilee Rossouw held on to a screamer.\n\nPBKS, however, couldn't create pressure as Sam Curran (1/50) conceded 16 runs, which included two fours and a six, with Will Jacks doing the maximum damage.\n\nKohli smashed Kaverappa for a six over long-off, but the bowler removed Jacks at the other end, with Harshal Patel (3/38) taking the catch for his second wicket.\n\nPatel, however, dropped Patidar and then conceded three boundaries while bowling as RCB scored 56 in the powerplay.\n\nIt started raining sixes thereafter as Kohli and Patidar slammed a maximum each to spoil Kaverappa's bowling figures.\n\nPatidar then creamed spinner Rahul Chahar for three mighty maximums before depositing Arshdeep and Sam Curran for two more sixes, the last one bringing up his fifty in 21 balls.\n\nWith Patidar on fire, RCB crossed 100 in the ninth overs. The Punjab skipper, however, got rid off Patidar in the 10th over with Jonny Bairstow holding on to an edge as RCB reached 119/3.\n\nRain briefly interrupted play as the spin duo of Liam Livingstone and Chahar bowled tidy overs after resumption. Kohli completed his fifty in 32 balls and hit Livingstone for two fours.\n\nGreen brought up the 150 with a four off Patel. Kohli then went berserk as he slog swept Livingstone for a six, while Curran was deposited over mid-wicket for a 94-metre maximum. He sent one over long-on for another maximum.\n\nDinesh Karthik (18) then helped RCB move past 240.", "source": {"uri": "latestly.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "LatestLY"}, "authors": [], {"uri": "8117219071", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-08", "time": "11:01:26", "dateTime": "2024-05-08T11:01:26Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-08T11:01:11Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6039215922355652, "url": "https://www.cricbuzz.com/cricket-news/130372/rcb-pbks-come-face-to-face-in-must-win-clash", "title": "RCB, PBKS come face-to-face in must-win clash", "body": "Such has been the competitive nature of this year's IPL that no team has officially been eliminated at the final leg of the league stage. Mumbai Indians, who have just four wins from 12 games, are also in with a shout, albeit a complicated one at that. Over the years, 16 points has been enough to make the cut but with the expansion to ten teams, it is no longer the case, Which is why teams like KKR and RR wouldn't want to relax despite sitting on 16 points. Meanwhile, PBKS and RCB are two teams who can only get as far as 14 points, meaning a host of other results need to go their way for qualification.\n\nIt is in such a scenario that they face-off at Dharamsala in a virtual elimination game with the loser joining Mumbai Indians on that bus that can only get as far as 12 points. By all means, this is a clash between two sides who couldn't have had more contrasting routes leading up to this game. Punjab Kings may have only recorded four wins so far from 11 games but the results don't tell you how close they were in many of their seven defeats to getting across the line. While top order failures cost them in most games, death bowling was also a concern in the other losses.\n\nThe high-intent approach of Punjab's batting did mean that they produced an unthinkable run chase against table toppers KKR, gunning down the highest T20 chase of all time. Most of their batting has revolved around the juniors like Shashank Singh and Ashutosh Sharma who had to do the heavy lifting after all the early damage. The duo have certainly impressed, more so Shashank, but it wasn't until Jonny Bairstow found form that Punjab started to look ominous. The heroics against KKR at Eden Gardens were followed by a special win against CSK at Chepauk but the defeat to the defending champions in the reverse fixture at Dharamsala has hurt Punjab's hopes. They do have the personnel to turn things around but it will boil down to their temperament under pressure.\n\nThe challenge for PBKS is that they are running into a RCB outfit that's on a three-match winning streak. IPL's eternal tragic heroes had just a solitary win in their first eight games, having been outplayed more often than not. Early elimination seemed certain until Faf du Plessis' men started to notch up one win after the other. It started by upstaging Sunrisers Hyderabad in Hyderabad before completing a double over Gujarat Titans. All three wins were achieved with a degree of dominance.\n\nThe lack of pressure in recent games may have been a reason, as suggested by Faf in his post-match presentations. Bangalore's batting line-up struggled for impetus in the first half of the season. But with nothing to lose (qualification chances are extremely complex), RCB has played with more freedom, especially with the bat. Faf's own form has spiked while the entry of Will Jacks has certainly added thrust to the batting unit. The bowling, which lacked purpose and discipline early on, seems to have worked out their strategies better in the last three games.\n\nThe nature of T20 cricket is such that the contrasting roadmaps of the two sides are not of much significance, given that they both find themselves in similar terrain. It may not be advertised as one but this is effectively a knockout game of sorts.\n\nWhen: Thursday, May 9 at 19:30 IST\n\nWhere: Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium, Dharamsala\n\nWhat to expect: The first game of the season saw a surprisingly slower surface with help for seamers with the new ball and spinners with the older ball. However, that was a day game and the venue has historically seen more joy for batters in night games. This could mean a much better batting track on offer. There should still be some help on offer for the pacers with the new ball.\n\nHead to Head: There isn't much to choose when it comes to the head-to-head stats between the two teams. The sides have faced each other 32 times with PBKS holding a slender 17-15 lead. RCB prevailed in the reverse fixture earlier this season in Bengaluru.\n\nTeam watch:\n\nPunjab Kings\n\nInjuries and unavailability: Shikhar Dhawan is yet to return to the setup\n\nTactics and matchups:Jonny Bairstow has had tremendous personal success against RCB. In five innings, he has a century and two fifties, tallying 261 runs at a staggering strike rate of 177.55. He also has a strike rate of 216 against RCB's powerplay specialist Mohammed Siraj, who has conceded 54 runs in 25 balls against the Englishman with one dismissal. Punjab will hope that Bairstow can deliver once more against his favourite franchise. PBKS are expected to be unchanged for this fixture, unless they want to bring back Liam Livingstone into the XI, which would mean an exit for Rilee Rossouw. However, that seems unlikely, as does the option of Shikhar Dhawan returning.\n\nProbable XI: Jonny Bairstow, Rilee Rossouw, Shashank Singh, Sam Curran (c), Jitesh Sharma (wk), Ashutosh Sharma, Harpreet Brar, Harshal Patel, Kagiso Rabada, Rahul Chahar, Arshdeep Singh. [Impact sub: Prabhsimran Singh]\n\nRoyal Challengers Bangalore\n\nInjuries/unavailability: RCB don't have any injury concerns in their camp.\n\nTactics and matchups:Between overs 7-15, Rajat Patidar has been going at a rollicking strike rate of 183. He has also perished seven times in 100 deliveries but his intent against spin will be crucial to RCB's chances, given the form of Punjab's spin duo Rahul Chahar and Harpreet Brar. It's rare for sides to change much when they are on a three-match winning streak and RCB are also expected to go with that pattern.\n\nProbable XI: Virat Kohli, Faf du Plessis (c), Glenn Maxwell, Will Jacks, Cameron Green, Dinesh Karthik, Karn Sharma, Swapnil Singh, Yash Dayal, Vijaykumar Vysakh, Mohammed Siraj. [Impact sub: Rajat Patidar].\n\nDid you know?\n\n- Seven of Mohammed Siraj's eight wickets have come while bowling first this season with an economy of 8.8 while his solitary wicket bowling second has come at an economy of 9.77\n\n- Harshal Patel has been expensive at the death but has also been a wicket-taker. He has 11 wickets in slog overs this season across 16 overs bowled.\n\nWhat they said:\n\n\"Not easy to switch between red and white ball cricket. You need to give your 110% every ball here (in T20s).\" - Mohammed Siraj explains the challenges of being a bowler in the shortest format\n\n\"The wicket was probably slower than we thought, we expected a little more pace and bounce, it was pretty similar throughout the game. Kings by 60 runs - Kmaupdates", "body": "PBKS vs RCB, IPL 2024 Highlights: All-round Royal Challengers Bengaluru keep playoff hopes alive with 60-run win over Punjab Kings\u00a9 Provided by The Times of India\n\nStar batter Virat Kohli slammed a 47-ball 92 as Royal Challengers Bengaluru posted 241/7 after being invited to bat first.\n\nEW DELHI: Virat Kohli and Rajat Patidar delivered impressive fifties before the bowlers shone, helping Royal Challengers Bengaluru keep their playoff hopes alive with a dominant 60-run victory over Punjab Kings in the IPL on Thursday.\n\nKohli's 47-ball 92 was the foundation of RCB's innings, as he excelled in two partnerships: 72 runs off 32 balls with Patidar (55 off 23 balls) and 92 runs off 46 balls with Cameron Green (46 off 27 balls), propelling RCB to 241/7.\n\nThis marked RCB's fourth consecutive win, bringing them to 10 points, while PBKS were eliminated from the playoff race with 8 points, as they can only reach a maximum of 12 points from their remaining two games.\n\nChasing a stiff target, PBKS lost Prabhsimran Singh (6) early but Rossouw looked unstoppable as left-arm spinner Swapnil Singh was carted for two fours before Siraj was belted for three fours and a six.\n\nIn response, Rilee Rossouw dazzled with a 27-ball 61, but Karn Sharma's twin breakthroughs sparked a collapse as PBKS were bowled out for 181 in 17 overs.\n\nThis marked RCB's fourth consecutive win, bringing them to 10 points, while PBKS were eliminated from the playoff race with 8 points, as they can only reach a maximum of 12 points from their remaining two games.\n\nSwapnil Singh (2/28), Karn (2/36) and Lockie Ferguson (2/29) took two each, while Mohammed Siraj (3/43) claimed three wickets for RCB.\n\nChasing a stiff target, PBKS lost Prabhsimran Singh "sim": 0.6000000238418579, "url": "https://www.newsdrum.in/sports/bowlers-complement-kohli-patidar-as-rcb-crush-pbks-by-60-runs-4550913", "title": "Bowlers complement Kohli, Patidar as RCB crush PBKS by 60 runs", "body": "Dharamsala, May 9 (PTI) Virat Kohli and Rajat Patidar conjured up superlative fifties before the bowlers joined the party as Royal Challengers Bengaluru kept their slim playoff hopes alive with a huge 60-run win over Punjab Kings in the IPL here on Thursday.\n\nKohli's 47-ball 92 was the cornerstone of RCB's innings as he starred in two partnerships -- 72 off 32 balls with Patidar (55 off 23 balls) and 92 off 46 balls with Cameron Green (46 off 27 balls) to propel the team to 241/7.\n\nIn reply, Rilee Rossouw put up a show with a 27-ball 61-run knock but Karn Sharma's twin strike triggered a collapse as PBKS were all out for 181 in 17 overs.\n\nThis was a fourth successive win for RCB and it took them to 10 points, while PBKS (8) were knocked out of the playoff race as they can reach a maximum of 12 points from the remaining two games.\n\nSwapnil Singh (2/28), Karn (2/36) and Lockie Ferguson (2/29) took two each, while Mohammed Siraj (3/43) claimed three wickets for RCB.\n\nChasing a stiff target, PBKS lost Prabhsimran Singh (6) early but Rossouw looked unstoppable as left-arm spinner Swapnil Singh was carted for two fours before Siraj was belted for three fours and a six.\n\nYash Dayal and Ferguson were then hit for 16 and 14 runs by Jonny Bairstow (27) and Rossouw as PBKS scored 75 runs in six overs.\n\nOnce Bairstow was removed by Ferguson, Rossouw turned his attention on Green, blasting two fours and a six on way to his fifty off 21 balls.\n\nJitesh Sharma was then cleaned up by Karn, while Swapnil got rid of Liam Livingstone (0) as Punjab slipped to 126 for 5 in 12th over.\n\nThey couldn't recover from those blows and it was all over when Shashank Singh (37), Sam Curran (22) and Ashutosh Sharma (8) returned to the dugout.\n\nEarlier, Kohli, who was dropped on 0 and 10, timed the ball nicely, used his feet and wrists to bring up his sixth IPL fifty this season. He reached his mark in 32 balls, before slamming another 40 in his next 15 balls. He cracked seven fours and six maximums.\n\nPatidar, who was also given two lives, provided the early momentum as he slammed six maximums and three fours during his 23-ball 55.\n\nAfter Patidar's dismissal, Kohli and Green continued the onslaught to take RCB past the 200-mark. Green hit five fours and a six before being caught in the final ball as RCB scored 77 in last five overs.\n\nPacer Vidhwath Kaverappa (2/36) picked up two wickets in the powerplay on his IPL debut but his figures could have been much better had the fielders not dropped three catches off his bowling.\n\nKohli was dropped in the third ball but Kaverappa dismissed Faf du Plessis (9) and removed Will Jacks (12) but PBKS couldn't create pressure as Sam Curran (1/50) and Harshal Patel (3/38) leaked runs.\n\nPatel, who had dropped Patidar, conceded three boundaries in his first over as RCB scored 56 in the powerplay.\n\nIt started raining sixes thereafter as Kohli and Patidar slammed a maximum each to spoil Kaverappa's bowling figures.\n\nPatidar then creamed spinner Rahul Chahar for three mighty maximums before depositing Arshdeep and Sam Curran for two more sixes, the last one bringing up his fifty in 21 balls.\n\nWith Patidar on fire, RCB crossed 100 in the ninth over. Curran, however, got rid of Patidar in the 10th over, when rain halted play for a brief while.\n\nAfter resumption, Kohli completed his fifty and hit Livingstone for two fours.\n\nGreen brought up the 150 with a four off Patel. Kohli then went berserk as he slog swept Livingstone for a six, while Curran was deposited over mid-wicket for a 94-metre maximum. He sent one over long-on for another maximum.\n\nDinesh Karthik (18) played a cameo before Patel claimed three wickets in last over.
