{"uri": "2024-05-349789969", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "05:36:17", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T05:36:17Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T05:19:18Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5176470875740051, "url": "https://www.sportskeeda.com/cricket/rcb-predicted-playing-xi-vs-pbks-match-58-ipl-2024", "title": "RCB Predicted Playing XI vs PBKS for Match 58 of IPL 2024", "body": "The Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) will take on the Punjab Kings (PBKS) in Match 58 of the 2024 Indian Premier League (IPL) at the HPCA Stadium in Dharamsala on Thursday, May 9. Faf du Plessis and Co. will want to sustain the momentum they have built over the last three matches.\n\nBengaluru have taken six points from their last three fixtures and find themselves seventh in the standings, with four wins from 11 matches. While a playoff berth is likely still going to elude them, they have put up a fight and will want to continue in the same vein over their final league assignments.\n\nRCB have come across a fairly settled combination, and the team management might not be inclined to tinker with it.\n\nRCB's squad for IPL 2024: Faf du Plessis (c), Glenn Maxwell, Virat Kohli, Cameron Green, Rajat Patidar, Anuj Rawat, Dinesh Karthik, Suyash Prabhudessai, Will Jacks, Mahipal Lomror, Karn Sharma, Manoj Bhandage, Mayank Dagar, Akash Deep, Mohammed Siraj, Reece Topley, Himanshu Sharma, Rajan Kumar, Vijaykumar Vyshak, Alzarri Joseph, Yash Dayal, Tom Curran, Lockie Ferguson, Swapnil Singh, Saurav Chauhan.\n\nOn that note, here's RCB's predicted playing XII (including one impact sub) for Match 58 of IPL 2024 against PBKS.\n\nOpeners: Faf du Plessis (c) and Virat Kohli\n\nRCB's captain had been in some indifferent form for a while, but he truly came into his own in the last game. Faf du Plessis, who has an excellent record against PBKS, will want to keep his good run going.\n\nMeanwhile, Virat Kohli has been impeccably consistent in IPL 2024. Up against Punjab's pace quartet, the veteran batter will be key for the away side.\n\nMiddle Order: Will Jacks, Rajat Patidar, Glenn Maxwell, Cameron Green, and Dinesh Karthik (wk)\n\nRCB are unlikely to make any changes to the middle order, which has worked well over the last few matches.\n\nWill Jacks and Rajat Patidar have mauled anything that has come their way, while Cameron Green's hit-the-deck skills have been useful in the middle overs. Meanwhile, Glenn Maxwell will have an eye on contributing against his former franchise.\n\nIf Bengaluru need an extra batter, they could bring in either Suyash Prabhudessai or Mahipal Lomror. However, that would leave them terribly short in the bowling department, so they are unlikely to adopt that strategy unless they bowl first.\n\nLower Order: Swapnil Singh, Karn Sharma, Vyshak Vijaykumar, Mohammed Siraj, and Yash Dayal\n\nKarn Sharma and Swapnil Singh will be RCB's premier spinners, with Mohammed Siraj leading the pace attack. {"uri": "2024-05-349804221", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "05:54:25", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T05:54:25Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T05:30:00Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5176470875740051, "url": "https://www.sportskeeda.com/cricket/ipl-2024-predicting-3-players-pick-wickets-today-s-pbks-vs-rcb-match", "title": "IPL 2024: Predicting 3 players who could pick up the most wickets in today's PBKS vs RCB match", "body": "A lot has changed since Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) and Punjab Kings (PBKS) first met in the early days of IPL 2024. RCB won that game at the Chinnaswamy Stadium, giving their fans hope that this could be the year they changed their poor home form and PBKS looked set to fall flat again.\n\nBut now, the season has gone pretty similarly for both teams. They have struggled immensely in home games and despite finding new heroes, haven't been helped by the poor forms of some of their experienced campaigners. In the second half, both sides have been seen more as \"entertainers\" than competitors for the league.\n\nThat entertainment has brought them to a knockout game. Whoever win the reverse fixture in Dharamshala on Thursday will keep their playoff hope alive (even if barely alive). The loser will be knocked out of the race once and for all.\n\nBelow, we have predicted three bowlers who could be the biggest drivers behind their teams' respective goals by picking up the most wickets:\n\n#3 Harpreet Brar\n\nIn the Chinnaswamy game, when most PBKS bowlers went at an economy rate of 10 or above, Harpreet Brar bowled a four-over spell of 2/13, taking the wickets of Rajat Patidar and Glenn Maxwell in the middle overs. Had Shikhar Dhawan used his quota better, he might have won PBKS that game.\n\nStand-in captain Sam Curran, despite giving Brar just one over against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) in the last match, is unlikely to make that mistake. He'd know that Brar has eight wickets in six games against RCB at an average of 20 - his best against any IPL opponent. Most RCB batters struggle against left-arm spin, including Virat Kohli, who has gotten out to him more than once.\n\nThe Dharamshala wicket offered even more turn than what he got at the Chinnaswamy and that's likely to make his bowling even more effective.\n\n#2 Mohammed Siraj\n\nAfter a lean first half, Mohammed Siraj looks close to his best in IPL 2024. He has three wickets in the last two games and is coming off his best spell of the season against Gujarat Titans where he started by removing both the openers.\n\nThe other game where he took two wickets this season was against PBKS at the Chinnaswamy. Siraj has now found consistency and stopped leaking runs as well.\n\nPBKS' top-order troubles are well-documented. Apart from Prabhsimran Singh, they haven't found anyone to either hold the innings or put pressure on the opposition consistently. Siraj has used that well in the past, taking 10 wickets in nine games, including his IPL-best spell of 4/21 last year.\n\nIf he hits the right areas early, Siraj might produce another breathtaking spell in Dharamshala.\n\n#1 Harshal Patel\n\nThe slower-one PBKS pacer Harshal Patel used to get MS Dhoni out the other night told all you need to know about him. When there's a bit of grip on the surface, he becomes one of the most deceptive fast bowlers in the league. And that grip is available in Dharamshala which got him a spell of 3/24 against CSK.\n\nIn the Chinnaswamy game, he took the important wicket of Virat Kohli. Bowling against his old franchise RCB might bring some extra motivation again. He already has 17 wickets in 11 games at an average of 21.29 (the best since 2021) and is second in the race for the Purple Cap. {"uri": "8119611400", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "18:17:08", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T18:17:08Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T18:16:49Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5058823823928833, "url": "https://www.newsbytesapp.com/news/sports/punjab-kings-vs-royal-challengers-bengaluru-key-stats/story", "title": "IPL 2024: RCB defeat PBKS, claim their fourth successive win", "body": "Royal Challengers Bengaluru defeated Punjab Kings in Match 58 of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 season on Thursday in Dharamsala. RCB posted a massive score of 241/7. Virat Kohli led the way with 92. Rajat Patidar smashed 55. In response, PBKS saw Rilee Rossouw show teeth with a fluent fifty. However, RCB picked regular wickets to pick up their 4th successive win.\n\nPBKS paid the price for some ordinary fielding as they dropped several catches. Both Kohli and Patidar were dropped and they went on to smash pivotal half-centuries and shared a telling partnership. Kohli also added quality runs (92) alongside Cameron Green. For Punjab, Harshal Patel claimed a three-fer. In response, PBKS did well in the powerplay but the wicket of Rossouw thereafter hurt them.\n\nPatidar arrived when RCB were 44/2 after 4.4 overs. He was dropped by Harshal Patel off the second ball he faced. Patidar's 23-ball 55 was laced with three fours and six sixes (SR: 239.13). This was Patidar's fourth fifty this season. Notably, it was his 4th successive fifty in away matches this season. Patidar owns 268 runs this season at 26.80 (SR: 183.56).\n\nKohli smashed 92 from 47 balls. As per ESPNcricinfo, Kohli became just the second player in IPL history to smash 1,000-plus runs against Punjab. David Warner holds the record with 1,134 runs from 26 matches at 49.30. Warner owns 13 fifties versus Punjab. Kohli has raced to 1,030 runs from 32 matches at 35.51. He has five fifties and a ton (SR: 133.76).\n\nAs per Cricbuzz, this is only the second instance of Kohli getting dismissed in the 90s in IPL. The first time it happened was a score of 99 versus Delhi Capitals in Delhi (IPL 2013).\n\nPlaying his 249th IPL match, Kohli hit seven fours and six sixes against PBKS (SR: 195.74). He has raced to 7,897 runs at 38.71. His strike rate is 131.63. The 35-year-old clobbered his 55th IPL fifty (100s: 8). He is two shy of 700 fours (698). In the ongoing season, Kohli owns 634 runs from 12 matches at 70.44 (50s: 5, 100s: 1).\n\nKohli is just the second Indian batter with 400-plus T20 sixes. Rohit Sharma has smashed 506 sixes so far in his career. Playing his 388th T20 match (371 innings), Kohli has raced to 401 sixes. MS Dhoni (334 sixes) is the next best among Indian players. Meanwhile, the IPL ace owns 12,628 T20 runs at 42.09. He has hit nine centuries and 96 fifties.\n\nPlaying his 12th match this season, Harshal (3/38) now owns to 20 wickets at 20.00 (ER: 9.75). He is the only bowler to scale 20-plus scalps. Harshal, who clocked 3/38 from his four overs, has displaced Jasprit Bumrah for the IPL 2024 Purple Cap this season. Mumbai Indians pacer Bumrah has 18 scalps from 12 matches at 16.50.\n\nVeteran South African batter Rossouw smashed his 50th half-century in T20 cricket. Notably, Rossouw became the fourth South African batter to accomplish 50 half-centuries in the 20-over format. Only AB de Villiers (69), Faf du Plessis (68), and Quinton de Kock (61) boast more fifties in T20 cricket among Proteas batters. In addition to 50 fifties, Rossouw has six T20 tons.\n\nRossouw hit a 27-ball 61 versus RCB in Dharamsala. He smashed nine fours and three sixes (SR: 225.93). Rossouw has raced to 8,377 runs at 29.70 (SR: 143-plus). Rossouw hit his second fifty in IPL. The first one also came at the same venue last year - 82* for DC vs PBKS. In 20 IPL matches, Rossouw has 402 runs at 22.33.\n\nShashank Singh fought hard for Punjab. He scored 37 from 19 balls. Shashank clobbered four fours and two sixes (SR: 194.74). In 12 matches this season, Shashank owns 352 runs at 58.66. Contributions from Rajat Patidar (55 off 23) and Cameron Green (46 off 27) further bolstered RCB's innings, setting a daunting target for PBKS.\n\nPBKS' bowling attack struggled to contain RCB's aggressive batting lineup, with Harshal Patel being the most successful bowler, claiming three wickets while conceding 38 runs in his spell.\n\nChasing a challenging target of 242 runs, PBKS got off to a shaky start, losing their opener Prabhsimran Singh early for just six runs. Both sides can get to as far as 14 points although they might have to bank on the outcome of some other clashes to mathematically find themselves in the top four.\n\nBut the loser of Thursday's contest will join the Mumbai Indians which can only get to 12 points, leaving their chances hanging on by the barest of threads. By all means, no team can afford a loss even as they head into the contest on the back of contrasting outcomes.\n\nPunjab Kings have recorded four victories from 11 games so far, but have gone down by the closest of margins in most of their seven losses, thanks to their inconsistent top order batting and death over bowling. A few nights ago, the Punjab Kings recorded the highest ever T20 chase against Kolkata Knight Riders at the Eden Gardens and followed it up by a special win against Chennai Super Kings at Chepauk but the defeat to the defending champions in the reverse fixture at Dharamsala has hurt Punjab's hopes\n\nPunjab's batting in IPL 2024 has mainly revolved around the unsung heroes like Shashank Singh and Ashutosh Sharma who had to do the heavy lifting after all the early damage. The duo has certainly impressed, more so Shashank, but during the chase against KKR, it was Jonny Bairstow finding his rhythm back at the right time, when Punjab started to look ominous. However, their impressive batting form was rendered hapless by a smart CSK bowling outfit in Dharamsala, and the home side can't afford another below-par performance against RCB.\n\nThe RCB on the other hand, have also managed to win four matches out of their 11 so far, but three of their wins have been part of a late resurgence from the Faf du Plessis-led side. Down and out after seven losses in their first eight games, the RCB bounced back strongly by recording three consecutive victories that started by upstaging Sunrisers Hyderabad in Hyderabad before completing a double over Gujarat Titans.\n\nFaf had rightly pointed out during one of the recent post-match presentations, that the late resurgence could be due to lack of pressure on the team. With their top order, including Faf and his opening partner Virat Kohli going great guns, and the likes of Will Jacks, Cameron Green and Dinesh Karthik adding meat to their scores, it could be a mouth-watering contest against Punjab's high-flying bowling unit led by Kagiso Rabada, and comprising the likes of Sam Curran, Arshdeep Singh, Harshal Patel and the spin duo of Harpreet Brar and Rahul {"uri": "8119540548", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "17:18:36", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T17:18:36Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T17:17:53Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4980392158031464, "url": "https://www.hindustantimes.com/cricket/virat-kohli-drops-cheeky-strike-rate-comment-after-smashing-7-fours-and-6-sixes-in-pbks-vs-rcb-ipl-2024-match-101715273995847.html", "title": "Virat Kohli drops cheeky 'strike rate' comment after smashing 7 fours and 6 sixes in PBKS vs RCB IPL 2024 match", "body": "It's very difficult to keep the spotlight away from Virat Kohli. He is such a prolific run-scorer that it becomes news even if he misfires once. And if the format is T20s, then scoring runs doesn't help. The chatter shifts to his strike rate. And rightly so, as the format is such. But should there be talk about a player of Kohli's calibre when he is the running Orange Cap holder of IPL 2024 and striking at 148? That's perhaps what has irked Kohli.\n\nThe Royal Challengers Bengaluru batter once again dropped a remark about his strike rate after smashing a blistering 92 off just 47 balls against Punjab Kings in Dharamsala on Thursday. Kohli's strike rate was 195.74 against PBKS and it never really dropped throughout the innings. The result? RCB posted their highest score of the season and Kohli's strike rate jumped from 148 to 153 this year.\n\nKohli strengthened his hold on the Orange Cap by taking a giant lead over CSK skipper Ruturaj Gaikwad. Kohli now has 634 runs in 13 matches.\n\n\"It was important to keep up my strike-rate through the innings, so I wanted to take on the momentum,\" Kohli said with a wry smile during the mid-innings interview with the broadcasters.\n\nKohli hit seven fours and six sixes. The butterfingered Punjab fielders were guilty of dropping catches as Kohli and Patidar capitalised on the reprieves to put on 72 off 32 balls after they were invited to bat.\n\nKohli, who was dropped on 0 and 10, made PBKS pay as he timed the ball nicely, used his feet and wrists to bring up his sixth IPL fifty this season.\n\n\"It was a tricky phase when Rajat got out, we got three down and the rain came in. So we needed a bit of time to settle but once Cameron hit a few, I thought 'I have to go again',\" Kohli said.\n\nPatidar, who was also given two lives, provided the early momentum as he slammed six maximums and three fours during his 23-ball 55. Kohli and Cameron Green (46 off 27 balls) continued the onslaught, adding 92 runs off 46 balls to take RCB across the 200-mark.\n\nGreen hit five fours and a six before being caught in the final ball of the innings as RCB scored 77 in the last five overs.\n\n\"The wicket was a bit two-paced. The ones pitching on the grassy ones were skidding on. Great opportunity for our bowlers to make the early inroads. (Good total batting first today) We weren't thinking about it. We thought 230+ would be a good total here. Bowlers are confident with recent successes. That was the only mindset. {"uri": "8119509188", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "16:53:55", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T16:53:55Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T16:53:32Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4862745106220245, "url": "https://www.indiatvnews.com/sports/cricket/virat-kohli-narrowly-misses-his-century-after-matching-kl-rahul-s-unique-ipl-milestone-2024-05-09-930511", "title": "Virat Kohli narrowly misses his century after matching KL Rahul's unique IPL milestone", "body": "Virat Kohli registered a sensational knock against Punjab Kings in the crucial fixture in IPL 2024 to shatter multiple records on Thursday. Kohli scored 92* off just 47 balls to help Royal Challengers Bengaluru post a 241 total at Dharamsala's Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium.\n\nAfter teaching a 62-run mark, Kohli became the only second cricketer to complete 1,000 runs against Punjab Kings. Kohli also surpassed a 600-run mark this season and equalled KL Rahul's record for scoring 600-plus runs most times in the IPL season.\n\nThe RCB stalwart has registered 1,000-plus runs against Chennai Super Kings and Delhi Capitals in IPL. He surpassed Rohit Sharma and David Warner's major record for 1000-plus runs against most opponents in IPL history.\n\nThe 35-year-old legend now has recorded 600-plus runs in four different editions (2011, 2016, 2023, 2024) to equal KL Rahul's unique milestone. {"uri": "8119545882", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "17:22:26", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T17:22:26Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T17:21:46Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4862745106220245, "url": "https://www.devdiscourse.com/article/sports-games/2933761-virat-reaches-another-record-scores-600-plus-runs-for-fourth-time-in-ipl-to-join-kl-rahul", "title": "Virat reaches another record, scores 600-plus runs for fourth time in IPL to join KL Rahul | Sports-Games", "body": "It was another record-breaking day for star Royal Challengers Bengaluru and India batter Virat Kohli as he became the second player who has scored over 600 runs four times in the Indian Premier League (IPL)\n\nIt was another record-breaking day for star Royal Challengers Bengaluru and India batter Virat Kohli as he became the second player who has scored over 600 runs four times in the Indian Premier League (IPL). Virat accomplished this feat during his side's game against Punjab Kings at Dharamshala on Thursday.\n\nVirat smashed 92 in just 47 balls, with seven fours and six sixes. His runs came at a strike rate of 195.74. In the ongoing season, Virat holds the Orange Cap for the most runs, with 634 runs in 12 matches at an average of 70.44 and a strike rate of 153.51. He has scored a century and five fifties and his best score is 113*.\n\nVirat has four seasons with 600 or more runs in the IPL, tied with Lucknow Super Giants skipper KL Rahul. The previous 600-plus runs seasons for Virat came in: 2023 (639 runs in 14 matches at an average of 53.25, with two centuries and six fifties), 2016 (973 runs in 16 matches at an average of 81.08, with four centuries and seven fifties) and 2013 (634 runs in 16 matches at an average of 45.29, with six fifties).\n\nOther than Virat, West Indies legend Chris Gayle and Australian opener David Warner have three seasons each of 600-plus runs while Virat's skipper in RCB, Faf Du Plessis has two such seasons. Also, Virat completed his 1,000 runs against Punjab Kings, continuing his good run against the franchise. In 32 matches against the franchise, Virat has scored 1,030 runs at an average of 35.51 and a strike rate of 133.76, with a century and five fifties. His best score is 113.\n\nThe star batter also has 1,000 runs against Delhi Capitals (DC) and Chennai Super Kings (CSK), making him the first player in IPL to have 1,000 runs or more against three different opponents. In 249 IPL matches, Virat has scored 7,897 runs at an average of 38.71 and a strike rate of 131.63, with eight centuries and 55 fifties. His best score is 113*. He is the highest run-scorer in IPL of all time.\n\nAlso, this is the fifth 200-plus total posted by RCB this season, the most in any season, surpassing the total of four such totals back in 2016, when they reached finals. Coming to the game, PBKS opted to field first after winning the toss. After the dismissal of skipper Faf Du Plessis (9) and Will Jacks (12) early, Virat (92 in 47 balls, with seven fours and six sixes) and Rajat Patidar (55 in 23 balls, with three fours and six sixes) steadied the RCB's ship with a 76-run stand, keeping the strike rate high. Then, a fine knock by Cameron Green (46 in 27 balls, with five fours and a six) and his 92-run stand with Virat powered RCB to 241/7 in their 20 overs.\n\nHarshal Patel (3/38) was the pick of the bowlers for PBKS. Vidwath Kaverappa (2/36) also did fine on his debut. Apart from Kohli, David Warner and Rohit Sharma are the only ones to achieve the feat of scoring more than 1000 runs against two teams. However, the match has already garnered significant attention due to the absence of two cricketing superstars, Glenn Maxwell and Kagiso Rabada, from their respective teams.\n\nThe Royal Challengers Bangalore have made a surprising decision to leave out their veteran all-rounder, Glenn Maxwell, for this crucial encounter. Known for his explosive batting and crafty off-spin, Maxwell has been a pivotal figure for RCB in recent seasons, often single-handedly turning matches with his blistering knocks and crucial breakthroughs with the ball.\n\nWhile the exact reasons behind Maxwell's omission remain undisclosed, speculation suggests that the team management might have opted for a more balanced bowling attack, sacrificing the Australian's all-round abilities to accommodate the express pace of Lockie Ferguson.\n\nOn the other hand, the Punjab Kings have been dealt a significant blow with the unavailability of their premier fast bowler, Kagiso Rabada. The South African spearhead has been a standout performer for Punjab, consistently delivering match-winning spells with his lethal pace and impeccable control. Rabada's absence will undoubtedly impact Punjab's bowling strategy, as they will sorely miss his ability to make early inroads and stem the flow of runs in the death overs. The team has drafted in the hard-hitting Liam Livingstone to bolster their batting firepower, but the lack of a world-class fast bowler could prove costly against RCB's formidable batting lineup.\n\nBoth teams have endured contrasting fortunes in the IPL 2024 thus far, with RCB finding their groove under the astute leadership of Faf du Plessis, while Punjab Kings have struggled to maintain consistency, currently languishing in the lower echelons of the points table.\n\nDu Plessis, the wily South African, has marshaled his troops effectively, extracting the best from his star-studded batting lineup while ensuring a balanced bowling attack. On the other hand, Sam Curran, the young English all-rounder leading Punjab Kings, has faced the arduous task of managing a star-studded yet underperforming unit.\n\nAs the teams gear up for this high-octane clash, several individual battles promise to shape the narrative of the match. Virat Kohli's quest for a blistering innings against his former franchise, Faf du Plessis' calming presence at the crease, and the exploits of the emerging talents like Will Jacks and Cameron Green for RCB will be closely watched. Meanwhile, the Punjab Kings will heavily rely on the swashbuckling performances of Jonny Bairstow, Liam Livingstone, and the ever-reliable Arshdeep Singh to counter RCB's might. {"uri": "8119584602", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "17:55:05", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T17:55:05Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T17:54:42Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4705882370471954, "url": "https://www.latestly.com/agency-news/sports-news-virat-reaches-another-record-scores-600-plus-runs-for-fourth-time-in-ipl-to-join-kl-rahul-5953276.html", "title": "Sports News | Virat Reaches Another Record, Scores 600-plus Runs for Fourth Time in IPL to Join KL Rahul | LatestLY", "body": "Dharamsala (Himachal Pradesh) [India], May 9 (ANI): It was another record-breaking day for star Royal Challengers Bengaluru and India batter Virat Kohli as he became the second player who has scored over 600 runs four times in the Indian Premier League (IPL).\n\nVirat accomplished this feat during his side's game against Punjab Kings at Dharamshala on Thursday.\n\nAlso Read | ICC T20 World Cup 2024 All Squads: Full Players List of All Teams for Ninth Edition of Men's Twenty20 Cricket WC.\n\nVirat smashed 92 in just 47 balls, with seven fours and six sixes. His runs came at a strike rate of 195.74.\n\nIn the ongoing season, Virat holds the Orange Cap for the most runs, with 634 runs in 12 matches at an average of 70.44 and a strike rate of 153.51. He has scored a century and five fifties and his best score is 113*.\n\nAlso Read | KL Rahul To Resign As LSG Captain? Three Players Who Could Replace the Current Skipper for Remaining IPL 2024 Matches.\n\nVirat has four seasons with 600 or more runs in the IPL, tied with Lucknow Super Giants skipper KL Rahul.\n\nThe previous 600-plus runs seasons for Virat came in: 2023 (639 runs in 14 matches at an average of 53.25, with two centuries and six fifties), 2016 (973 runs in 16 matches at an average of 81.08, with four centuries and seven fifties) and 2013 (634 runs in 16 matches at an average of 45.29, with six fifties).\n\nOther than Virat, West Indies legend Chris Gayle and Australian opener David Warner have three seasons each of 600-plus runs while Virat's skipper in RCB, Faf Du Plessis has two such seasons.\n\nAlso, Virat completed his 1,000 runs against Punjab Kings, continuing his good run against the franchise. In 32 matches against the franchise, Virat has scored 1,030 runs at an average of 35.51 and a strike rate of 133.76, with a century and five fifties. His best score is 113.\n\nThe star batter also has 1,000 runs against Delhi Capitals (DC) and Chennai Super Kings (CSK), making him the first player in IPL to have 1,000 runs or more against three different opponents.\n\nIn 249 IPL matches, Virat has scored 7,897 runs at an average of 38.71 and a strike rate of 131.63, with eight centuries and 55 fifties. His best score is 113*. He is the highest run-scorer in IPL of all time.\n\nAlso, this is the fifth 200-plus total posted by RCB this season, the most in any season, surpassing the total of four such totals back in 2016, when they reached finals.\n\nComing to the game, PBKS opted to field first after winning the toss. After the dismissal of skipper Faf Du Plessis (9) and Will Jacks (12) early, Virat (92 in 47 balls, with seven fours and six sixes) and Rajat Patidar (55 in 23 balls, with three fours and six sixes) steadied the RCB's ship with a 76-run stand, keeping the strike rate high. Then, a fine knock by Cameron Green (46 in 27 balls, with five fours and a six) and his 92-run stand with Virat powered RCB to 241/7 in their 20 overs.\n\nHarshal Patel (3/38) was the pick of the bowlers for PBKS. Vidwath Kaverappa (2/36) also did fine on his debut. {"uri": "8119534840", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "17:13:53", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T17:13:53Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T17:13:32Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4705882370471954, "url": "https://www.aninews.in/news/sports/cricket/virat-reaches-another-record-scores-600-plus-runs-for-fourth-time-in-ipl-to-join-kl-rahul20240509224024/", "title": "Virat reaches another record, scores 600-plus runs for fourth time in IPL to join KL Rahul", "body": "Dharamsala (Himachal Pradesh) [India], May 9 (ANI): It was another record-breaking day for star Royal Challengers Bengaluru and India batter Virat Kohli as he became the second player who has scored over 600 runs four times in the Indian Premier League (IPL).\n\nVirat accomplished this feat during his side's game against Punjab Kings at Dharamshala on Thursday.\n\nVirat smashed 92 in just 47 balls, with seven fours and six sixes. His runs came at a strike rate of 195.74.\n\nIn the ongoing season, Virat holds the Orange Cap for the most runs, with 634 runs in 12 matches at an average of 70.44 and a strike rate of 153.51. He has scored a century and five fifties and his best score is 113*.\n\nVirat has four seasons with 600 or more runs in the IPL, tied with Lucknow Super Giants skipper KL Rahul.\n\nThe previous 600-plus runs seasons for Virat came in: 2023 (639 runs in 14 matches at an average of 53.25, with two centuries and six fifties), 2016 (973 runs in 16 matches at an average of 81.08, with four centuries and seven fifties) and 2013 (634 runs in 16 matches at an average of 45.29, with six fifties).\n\nOther than Virat, West Indies legend Chris Gayle and Australian opener David Warner have three seasons each of 600-plus runs while Virat's skipper in RCB, Faf Du Plessis has two such seasons.\n\nAlso, Virat completed his 1,000 runs against Punjab Kings, continuing his good run against the franchise. In 32 matches against the franchise, Virat has scored 1,030 runs at an average of 35.51 and a strike rate of 133.76, with a century and five fifties. His best score is 113.\n\nThe star batter also has 1,000 runs against Delhi Capitals (DC) and Chennai Super Kings (CSK), making him the first player in IPL to have 1,000 runs or more against three different opponents.\n\nIn 249 IPL matches, Virat has scored 7,897 runs at an average of 38.71 and a strike rate of 131.63, with eight centuries and 55 fifties. His best score is 113*. He is the highest run-scorer in IPL of all time.\n\nAlso, this is the fifth 200-plus total posted by RCB this season, the most in any season, surpassing the total of four such totals back in 2016, when they reached finals.\n\nComing to the game, PBKS opted to field first after winning the toss. After the dismissal of skipper Faf Du Plessis (9) and Will Jacks (12) early, Virat (92 in 47 balls, with seven fours and six sixes) and Rajat Patidar (55 in 23 balls, with three fours and six sixes) steadied the RCB's ship with a 76-run stand, keeping the strike rate high. Then, a fine knock by Cameron Green (46 in 27 balls, with five fours and a six) and his 92-run stand with Virat powered RCB to 241/7 in their 20 overs.\n\nHarshal Patel (3/38) was the pick of the bowlers for PBKS. Vidwath Kaverappa (2/36) also did fine on his debut. It appears that batting superstar Virat Kohli has established an close bond with his Royal Challengers Bengaluru captain Faf du Plessis so much so that the Indian is now influencing the South African's fashion choices as well.\n\nAhead of RCB's latest IPL 2024 clash in which they run into Punjab Kings, Du Plessis has shed some light on his relationship with teammate Kohli.\n\n\"We both love food,\" Du Plessis said on Star Sports. \"We both are really into our fashion. That's another thing we spend a lot of time talking about. The way we dress, what style of clothes. We would send each other pictures of outfits and stuff like that.\"\n\nHowever, there's another 'terrible influence' which the former South African skipper also blames on Kohli.\n\n\"He's been a terrible influence on me when it comes to watches, but he's got a real passion for watches,\" the 39-year-old said.\n\nStay updated with the latest from IPL 2024, including top contenders for the IPL 2024 Orange Cap and IPL 2024 Purple Cap. The tally includes a six and 4 fours.\n\nGlenn Maxwell, who is yet to fire in the ongoing IPL season, will once again face the wrath of Harpreet Brar. The PBKS spinner has dismissed him four times across just five IPL innings. Notably, Maxwell's strike rate against Brar plunges to 105.88. He has slammed just 2 sixes. He has been dismissed 45 times.\n\nRCB pacer Mohammed Siraj has had an interesting match-up with Jonny Bairstow in T20 cricket. The Indian seamer has dismissed Bairstow once in three T20 innings. {"uri": "8119541263", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "17:18:54", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T17:18:54Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T17:18:28Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4470588266849518, "url": "https://crickettimes.com/2024/05/ipl-2024-fans-reacts-as-virat-kohli-misses-out-on-a-century-by-a-whisker-during-pbks-vs-rcb-clash/", "title": "IPL 2024: Fans react as Virat Kohli misses out on a century by a whisker during PBKS vs RCB clash", "body": "In his latest appearance in the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024, Virat Kohli, the luminary of the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB), further solidified his supremacy with a dazzling performance against the Punjab Kings (PBKS) in Match 58 on Friday (May 9). Kohli's exceptional innings, embellished with a breathtaking display of skill and precision, exerted immense pressure on the PBKS team, exposing their vulnerabilities on the field. His sublime knock of 92 runs off just 47 deliveries, showcased at the magnificent setting of Dharamsala, was a testament to his unrivaled talent and unwavering determination.\n\nKohli's innings, however, didn't commence on the most auspicious note, as he encountered early challenges against the PBKS. Twice within the early stages of his innings, Kohli found himself offered lifelines by the opposition. The first reprieve came when Ashutosh Sharma failed to grasp a catch after Kohli skied a delivery from debutant Vidhwath Kaverappa. Shortly after, Kohli survived another scare as Rilee Rossouw nearly pulled off a spectacular catch off Kaverappa's bowling.\n\nFollowing his initial setbacks, Kohli swiftly shifted gears, capitalizing on the powerplay by unleashing an onslaught against PBKS' bowling attack. His assault began with a boundary off Sam Curran's bowling in the fourth over, signaling his intent to seize control of the proceedings. Despite losing partners such as Faf du Plessis and Will Jacks, Kohli persevered until he found an ideal ally in Rajat Patidar. Patidar, despite surviving an early catch scare, complemented Kohli's aggression with his own devastating stroke play, propelling the RCB's score past the 100 runs mark within nine overs. Patidar's blistering fifty off just 21 balls further bolstered the team's total before his departure, leaving a significant impact on the match.\n\nAs the partnership flourished, Kohli's momentum encountered a temporary disruption due to rain and hailstorms, halting the game after the completion of ten overs with the score standing at 119/3. Resuming play alongside Cameron Green, Kohli gradually regained his rhythm, punctuating his innings with two consecutive boundaries against Liam Livingstone. The Indian stalwart then unleashed a flurry of boundaries and sixes, captivating the crowd with his exquisite stroke play. His sublime batting display, exemplified by a majestic two sixes off Curran's bowling, reignited the atmosphere in the stadium.\n\nKohli's batting prowess was particularly pronounced on the leg-side, a domain where he exhibited sheer dominance against the bowling onslaught of Curran. Despite Curran's best efforts, Kohli's relentless assault persisted, driving home the advantage with boundaries and sixes that left the bowler reeling. With his sights set on a century, Kohli seemed destined for cricketing immortality as he dispatched deliveries from Arshdeep Singh for a boundary and a six. Nevertheless, fate had other plans, as his innings culminated at 92 runs when Rossouw clung on to a crucial catch, denying Kohli the milestone he so fervently pursued.\n\nNevertheless, Kohli's contribution proved monumental as RCB effortlessly breached the 200 runs mark, propelled by his seven boundaries and six towering sixes. Green's valiant knock of 46 runs further complemented Kohli's heroics, propelling RCB to a competitive score of 241/7 in their allotted 20 overs, thereby fortifying their quest for supremacy in the tournament.\n\nIn addition to his on-field exploits, Kohli etched his name in the annals of IPL history by becoming the first player to amass over 600 runs in this season, amassing a staggering total of 634 runs from his 12 outings. This remarkable feat not only underscored Kohli's unparalleled consistency but also elevated him to a league of his own, as he equaled KL Rahul's record of surpassing the 600 runs mark for the fourth Kohli enjoyed a slice of luck and capitalized on the same to the hilt. After a shaky start, where he was dropped on several occasions, he consolidated his game and stayed almost till the very end to guide his team to a challenging score.\n\nInitially, the pitch had something for the bowlers, but after a while -- in particular after the break due to rain -- it eased out. The rain-induced break gave Kohli the required rest and quickly analysed his game. He was a different batter from then and runs flowed from the meat of the blade. When he looked set for a century, Kohli got out to Arshdeep Singh, caught by Rossouw at the sweeper covers. Cameron Green towards the end put the long handle to effective use, making 46 off 27 balls.\n\nEarlier, put in to bat, RCB got off to a disastrous start as they lost skipper Faf du Plessis cheaply. Du Plessis had struck Vidwath Kaverappa for a couple of boundaries . In the very next over, Kaverappa changed lines and was rewarded. He bowled a back of length ball outside the off stump and induced Plessis to play a false stroke. Shashank Singh at deep point lapped up the offering.\n\nEarlier, Kaverappa had a chance to get Kohli out (who was yet to open his account). Kohli looked to whip a full length delivery through the on-side, but it swung away and went high off a thick leading edge. Ashutosh Sharma jogged back from point looking to settle under it, but missed it. He struck three sixes in a Rahul Chahar over. He too was dropped once and capitalized on it by scoring runs effortlessly of each and every bowler to reach his half century. Rajat's end came when he chased a wide delivery off Sam Curran to edge it to Jonny Bairstow behind the stumps. Kohli, riding on the generosity of the Punjab fielders, was on 42 when play was halted due to rain. Before the PBKS vs RCB clash, let's examine how the pitch conditions might influence the game.\n\nThe hybrid pitch at Dharamshala's HPCA Stadium, located amidst the stunning Himalayan backdrop, posed a lot of uncertainties during the first match of the season when Punjab Kings played Chennai Super Kings. It played slower than expected, with 167 runs proving enough for a successful defence. This pitch is generally known for its pace, bounce, and lateral movement, favouring the fast bowlers.\n\nPacers thrive on this surface, especially during the powerplay, where there's ample movement and bounce. However, spinners find little assistance from the pitch, as there's minimal turn. Consequently, it's a great track for batting, providing occasional bounce and movement to keep things interesting for the bowlers.\n\nGiven these conditions, the team winning the toss typically opts to bowl first and chase the target. He has also scored 1,000 runs against Punjab Kings.In a stunning display of prowess, Royal Challengers Bengaluru's former captain and Indian cricket stalwart, Virat Kohli, has scripted history yet again in the IPL and has joined an elite club.\n\nDuring RCB's clash against Punjab Kings in Dharamshala, Kohli became only the second player to amass over 600 runs in four separate IPL seasons, sharing this feat with Lucknow Super Giants' skipper KL Rahul.\n\nKohli's scintillating innings of 92 runs off just 47 balls, with seven fours and six sixes, propelled him to this remarkable achievement, executed at a blistering strike rate of 195.74. rate of 153.51.\n\nHis batting brilliance this season includes a century and five fifties, with a highest score of 113*.\n\nKohli's previous seasons with 600-plus runs include remarkable displays in 2023, 2016, and 2013, showcasing his consistency and dominance in the IPL.\n\nAside from this milestone, Kohli also surpassed scoring 1,000 runs against Punjab Kings, showing pure class not just against the franchise but the tournament.\n\nRemarkably, Kohli has achieved the feat of amassing over 1,000 runs against three different opponents in the IPL, a testament to his batting excellence and versatility.\n\nWith this remarkable feat, Kohli becomes one of the most prolific run-scorers in IPL history, amassing a staggering 7,897 runs in 249 matches, with an average of 38.71 and an Singh played his first match for RCB against Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) in Hyderabad.\n\nPlaying against a dangerous batting lineup, Singh came in to bowl the fifth over, with Aiden Markram and Nitish Kumar Reddy batting in the middle. He got rid of Markram and an in-form Heinrich Klaasen in his first over itself.\n\nIn a chat with IPLT20.com before the match against Punjab Kings, Swapnil said that he had told at home that he would bowl at least six balls this season. However, he ended up bowling a no-ball in his first over, which led to an extra delivery. Interestingly, Swapnil bagged Klaasen's wicket on the seventh ball of that over.\n\n\"I had told at home that if I get to play, I will bowl at least six balls, but in that over, I ended up bowling seven balls. So, I believe it was God's plan. In my mind, I was thinking that I should use my experience and bowl accordingly. I wanted to bowl the delivery which I have practiced,\" Singh said.\n\n\"Klaasen's wicket was a prime example. Before the wicket, he hit me for a six on a ball that dipped. I was thinking that I have already conceded a six, so I should bowl my best ball on the last ball. With God's blessing, I got him out,\" Swapnil Singh added.\n\nSwapnil's double strike helped RCB defend a 207-run target against SRH and win the match by 35 runs. He has been a regular part of the team since then.\n\nRCB have not lost a single match in IPL 2024 where Swapnil Singh has played\n\nRCB had a disappointing first half in IPL 2024 as they lost seven out of their first eight matches. He was dropped by Harshal Patel off the second ball he faced. Vidhwath Kaverappa was the bowler. This proved to be costly as Patidar smashed Harshal for three fours in the 6th over. Kaverappa was dispatched next for a six before Rahul Chahar was smacked for three maximums. {"eng-9548702": {"articles": {"results": [{"uri": "8119888824", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "22:50:14", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T22:50:14Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T22:49:39Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5960784554481506, "url": "https://www.espn.in/cricket/series/8048/report/1426296/punjab-kings-vs-royal-challengers-bengaluru-58th-match-ipl", "title": "Recent Match Report - Punjab Kings vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru, Indian Premier League 2024, 58th Match | ESPN.in", "body": "Kohli keeps RCB alive in playoffs race; Punjab Kings knocked out\n\nRoyal Challengers Bengaluru 241 for 7 (Kohli 92, Patidar 55, Green 46, Harshal 3-38, Kaverappa 2-36) beat Punjab Kings 181 (Rossouw 61, Shashank 37, Siraj 3-43, Swapnil 2-28, Ferguson 2-29, Karn 2-36) by 60 runs\n\nVirat Kohli's breakneck 92 off 47, plus his spectacular direct hit to run Shashank Singh out, were the basis of Royal Challengers Bengaluru's (RCB's) fourth consecutive win, this time against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in Dharamsala. The result kept RCB's hopes of making the IPL 2024 playoffs alive, if only just, but knocked PBKS out of contention.\n\nRCB batted first and blasted their way to 241 for 7, with Rajat Patidar crashing 55 off 23, and Cameron Green hitting 46 off 27. Both had productive partnerships with Kohli, worth 76 off 32 and 92 off 46 respectively.\n\nIn response, PBKS started strong, but RCB's spinners - Karn Sharma and Swapnil Singh - were effective through the early middle overs, dismissing Rilee Rossouw in the ninth, Jitesh Sharma in the 11th, and Liam Livingstone in the 12th.\n\nWith the required rate now high above the run rate, it was curtains for PBKS. They ended 181 all out after 17 overs.\n\nKohli anyway started the match as the IPL's highest run-scorer. But having been reprieved on zero, he went on to play one of his best innings of a stellar season, finding boundaries through the covers, through midwicket, and down the ground - his footwork often immaculate.\n\nThough he opened the batting, he didn't have a lot of the strike, facing only 14 balls in the powerplay. But before long he was striking at well over 150, as he found capable partners in Patidar (who was the more aggressive partner in their stand), and then Green.\n\nIt was a vintage Kohli innings, full of powerful wristy flicks and hard running, though towards the end he also got his six-hitting game going, finishing with six maximums overall.\n\nHe seemed poised to make his second triple-figure score of the season, but sliced a wide Arshdeep Singh delivery and was caught at deep cover in the 18th over.\n\nKohli's wild gesticulations, it turns out, are not the only expenditure of his energy on the field.\n\nFourth ball of the 14th over into the PBKS innings, they needed 92 runs off 39 balls, and as long as Shashank was at the crease, they had an outside chance. But that's when Sam Curran dropped one towards midwicket and called for two, and that was when Kohli took off from deep midwicket, speeding towards the ball, swooping on it, and skidding it mid-dive towards the one wicket he had to aim at, and found his target.\n\nShashank was not as committed to the run as Kohli was to this piece of fielding, and Shashank was centimetres short of his ground, not having put in a dive. He was out for 39 off 19 balls, leaving PBKS 151 for 6. They would end up losing their last five wickets for 30 runs.\n\nBefore that Kohli run out, however, legspinner Karn and left-arm spinner Swapnil had made vital strikes as well. Swapnil removed Prabhsimran Singh in the first over of the innings, before coming back in the middle overs to get Liam Livingstone tamely offer a leading edge into the covers.\n\nKarn took two big wickets too. He first had the opposition's best batter Rossouw caught at long-on in the ninth over, and then bowled a big, juicy legbreak that clattered into Jitesh's stumps in the 11th over.\n\nAlthough they would fall well short, PBKS did look capable of chasing down 242 at the start. They made 75 in the powerplay, thanks largely to Rossouw, who had clobbered seven fours and a six while the fielding restrictions were in place.\n\nRossouw continued to blast RCB's seam bowlers in particular, motoring his way to a 21-ball half-century, before Karn eventually got him. Jonny Bairstow's 27 off 16, and Shashank's knock were the other serious contributors.", "source": {"uri": "espn.in", "dataType": "news", "title": "ESPN"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": {"eng-9548702": {"articles": {"results": [{"uri": "8119893518", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "22:56:37", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T22:56:37Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T22:55:38Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6392157077789307, "url": "https://www.hindustantimes.com/cricket/boys-have-shown-character-to-turn-it-around-rcb-skipper-faf-following-win-over-pbks-101715294041393.html", "title": "\"Boys have shown character to turn it around...\": RCB skipper Faf following win over PBKS", "body": "Dharamsala [India], : Following his side's 60-run win over Punjab Kings , Royal Challengers Bengaluru skipper Faf Du Plessis lauded his team for showing fine character to turn their season around.\n\nA fine half-century by Rilee Rossouw went in vain as Royal Challengers Bengaluru bowlers delivered a brilliant performance to bundle out Punjab Kings for just 181 runs and secure a 60-run win at Dharamsala on Thursday.\n\nSpeaking in the post-match presentation, Faf said, \"That was a good game. We have scored 200-plus in the last five or six games. We have had good conversations, we were making the same mistakes over and over again. We needed aggression with the bat. We just spoke about taking wickets. We have 6-7 options in the bowling department. You need some form on your side. A bit of luck is also required. We had a few guys looking for wickets and runs at the start of the tournament. The boys have shown character to turn it around. Everyone has chipped in with runs and the bowlers are taking wickets. For us it is important to focus on ourselves.\"\n\nComing to the game, PBKS opted to field first after winning the toss. After the dismissal of skipper Faf Du Plessis and Will Jacks early, Virat and Rajat Patidar steadied the RCB's ship with a 76-run stand, keeping the strike rate high. Then, a fine knock by Cameron Green and his 92-run stand with Virat powered RCB to 241/7 in their 20 overs.\n\nHarshal Patel was the pick of the bowlers for PBKS. Vidwath Kaverappa also did fine on his debut.\n\nIn the run-chase of 242 runs, Rilee Rossouw , Shashank Singh and Jonny Bairstow looked dangerous, but lost their wickets on crucial stages.The rest of the batters could not really put up a fight and lost the game by 60 runs as PBKS bundled out for 181 runs.\n\nMohammed Siraj was the top bowler for RCB with 3/43. Karn Sharma, Lockie Ferguson and Swapnil Singh also took two wickets.\n\nRCB is in the seventh spot with five wins and seven losses, with 10 points. PBKS is in ninth place, with four wins and eight losses, a total of eight points. {"eng-9548702": {"articles": {"results": [{"uri": "8119893513", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "22:58:29", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T22:58:29Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T22:55:38Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5960784554481506, "url": "https://www.hindustantimes.com/cricket/i-know-i-need-to-take-risks-rcb-s-virat-following-win-over-pbks-101715294041613.html", "title": "\"I know I need to take risks...\": RCB's Virat following win over PBKS", "body": "Dharamsala [India], : Following his side's 60-run win against Punjab Kings , in which he played a match-winning knock of 92 runs, Royal Challengers Bengaluru batter Virat Kohli said that he was looking to take more risks with his batting and played slog-sweep frequently against spinners just like he used to do in the past. He also said that at this stage of his career, the quality of his game and batting matters more over his runs.\n\nA fine half-century by Rilee Rossouw went in vain as Royal Challengers Bengaluru bowlers delivered a brilliant performance to bundle out Punjab Kings for just 181 runs and secure a 60-run win at Dharamsala on Thursday.\n\nSpeaking in the post-match presentation, Virat said, \"Still quality over quantity. More so at this stage of my career. Understanding your game over so many years allows you to practice but still stay switched on. And still aiming to improve aspects of your game that you want to get better on. I brought out the slog-sweep to the spinners. I know I can hit it as I have done it in the past. I know I need to take risks. It takes more conviction to remove the thought 'What if I get out?'.\"\n\n\"I am trying to keep up with the strike rate for me and the team. The only way to go through a tournament is to be honest with ourselves. We had those losses on the trot, we just had a honest conversation. We needed to pull up our socks. That game against KKR went down to the wire. We wanted to play for our self-respect. We just can't go out there and play in such a way and disappoint our fans. The confidence is back and we are on a roll. We have to depend on several other factors ,\" he added.\n\nComing to the game, PBKS opted to field first after winning the toss. After the dismissal of skipper Faf Du Plessis and Will Jacks early, Virat and Rajat Patidar steadied the RCB's ship with a 76-run stand, keeping the strike rate high. Then, a fine knock by Cameron Green and his 92-run stand with Virat powered RCB to 241/7 in their 20 overs.\n\nHarshal Patel was the pick of the bowlers for PBKS. Vidwath Kaverappa also did fine on his debut.\n\nIn the run-chase of 242 runs, Rilee Rossouw , Shashank Singh and Jonny Bairstow looked dangerous, but lost their wickets on crucial stages.\n\nThe rest of the batters could not really put up a fight and lost the game by 60 runs as PBKS bundled out for 181 runs.\n\nMohammed Siraj was the top bowler for RCB with 3/43. Karn Sharma, Lockie Ferguson and Swapnil Singh also took two wickets. {"eng-9548702": {"articles": {"results": [{"uri": "8119893513", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "22:58:29", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T22:58:29Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T22:55:38Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.5960784554481506, "url": "https://www.hindustantimes.com/cricket/i-know-i-need-to-take-risks-rcb-s-virat-following-win-over-pbks-101715294041613.html", "title": "\"I know I need to take risks...\": RCB's Virat following win over PBKS", "body": "Dharamsala [India], : Following his side's 60-run win against Punjab Kings , in which he played a match-winning knock of 92 runs, Royal Challengers Bengaluru batter Virat Kohli said that he was looking to take more risks with his batting and played slog-sweep frequently against spinners just like he used to do in the past. He also said that at this stage of his career, the quality of his game and batting matters more over his runs.\n\nA fine half-century by Rilee Rossouw went in vain as Royal Challengers Bengaluru bowlers delivered a brilliant performance to bundle out Punjab Kings for just 181 runs and secure a 60-run win at Dharamsala on Thursday.\n\nSpeaking in the post-match presentation, Virat said, \"Still quality over quantity. More so at this stage of my career. Understanding your game over so many years allows you to practice but still stay switched on. And still aiming to improve aspects of your game that you want to get better on. I brought out the slog-sweep to the spinners. I know I can hit it as I have done it in the past. I know I need to take risks. It takes more conviction to remove the thought 'What if I get out?'.\"\n\n\"I am trying to keep up with the strike rate for me and the team. The only way to go through a tournament is to be honest with ourselves. We had those losses on the trot, we just had a honest conversation. We needed to pull up our socks. That game against KKR went down to the wire. We wanted to play for our self-respect. We just can't go out there and play in such a way and disappoint our fans. The confidence is back and we are on a roll. We have to depend on several other factors ,\" he added.\n\nComing to the game, PBKS opted to field first after winning the toss. After the dismissal of skipper Faf Du Plessis and Will Jacks early, Virat and Rajat Patidar steadied the RCB's ship with a 76-run stand, keeping the strike rate high. Then, a fine knock by Cameron Green and his 92-run stand with Virat powered RCB to 241/7 in their 20 overs.\n\nHarshal Patel was the pick of the bowlers for PBKS. Vidwath Kaverappa also did fine on his debut.\n\nIn the run-chase of 242 runs, Rilee Rossouw , Shashank Singh and Jonny Bairstow looked dangerous, but lost their wickets on crucial stages.\n\nThe rest of the batters could not really put up a fight and lost the game by 60 runs as PBKS bundled out for 181 runs.\n\nMohammed Siraj was the top bowler for RCB with 3/43. Karn Sharma, Lockie Ferguson and Swapnil Singh also took two wickets. {"eng-9548702": {"articles": {"results": [{"uri": "8119919147", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-09", "time": "23:28:08", "dateTime": "2024-05-09T23:28:08Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-09T23:27:27Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6509804129600525, "url": "https://www.insidesport.in/cricket/pbks-vs-rcb-player-ratings-a-virat-kohli-special-sends-punjab-out-of-ipl-2024/", "title": "PBKS vs RCB Player Ratings: A Virat Kohli special sends Punjab out of IPL 2024", "body": "With their massive 60-run win, RCB thrashed PBKS out of IPL 2024 and keeps their playoff hopes alive\n\nPBKS vs RCB Player Ratings: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) kept their playoff hopes alive by registering one of their biggest wins of the season. They comprehensively best the Punjab Kings (PBKS) with a huge margin of 60 runs.\n\nIt was a complete team effort as RCB batters joined together to accumulate 241 runs in their first innings. While Rilee Rossouw looked threatening in the run-chase, it was uncomplicated for RCB, who kept dishing out brilliant deliveries to bundle PBKS out for 181.\n\nVirat Kohli (9.5/10): A record-breaking knock by the modern-day master as he agonizingly missed his ninth IPL hundred by just eight runs. The RCB talisman played with superb intent and struck at a fantastic rate of 195. Kohli even pulled off a stunning run-out in the second innings.\n\nFaf du Plessis (6.5/10): The intent was there for RCB skipper as well but failed to go past 9-run mark. However, he plucked a superb flying catch to dismiss Jonny Bairstow.\n\nWill Jacks (6/10): The Englishman smashed one four and a six in the 7 balls he faced but failed to capitalize.\n\nRajat Patidar (8.5/10): The underrated star of the night for certainly Rajat Patidar, who clubbed 55 off a mere 23 balls. He looked in supreme touch as he took apart the PBKS bowlers with ease.\n\nCameron Green (7.5/10): The mighty Australian provided a superb finish down the order as he scored 46 off only 27 deliveries.\n\nDinesh Karthik (8.5/10): The Indian veteran continued his remarkable season with another effective cameo (18 off 7).\n\nMahipal Lomror (2/10): Came to bat in the last over but recorded a two-ball duck.\n\nSwapnil Singh (8/10): Was superb with the ball as he took two wickets in his three overs. Swapnil has been great for RCB.\n\nKarn Sharma (8/10): From one spinner to another, Karn Sharma bagged two big wickets of Rilee Rossouw and Jitesh Sharma.\n\nMohd Siraj (7.5/10): Looked wayward with the new ball but showed great courage to come at death and took three wickets in total.\n\nLockie Ferguson 8/10): The Kiwi speedster looked in great touch. With two wickets to his name, Ferguson even varied his pace quite brilliantly.\n\nJonny Bairstow (6.5/10): Bairstow would've kicked himself for not converting the start he got vs RCB. He was deceived by a slower one from Ferguson.\n\nRilee Rossouw (8/10): The left-hander was undoubtedly PBKS' best batsman on the night, striking 61 off a mere 27 deliveries. He needed support from the other end but was eventually dismissed by Karn Sharma.\n\nShashank Singh (7/10): Shashank batted slightly higher and looked superb for his 37. He, however, was involved in a crash against Faf before getting run-out with a superb fielding effort by Virat Kohli.\n\nJitesh Sharma (2/10): Dropped to the substitutes, the Indian international once again failed. He got only five runs before getting castled.\n\nLiam Livingstone (1/10): Brought in the team in place of Kagiso Rabada, the Englishman failed miserably.\n\nSam Curran (3/10): Giving the penultimate over to spinner Rahul Chahar, Curran's tactics were a little off vs RCB. He even failed to contribute with either bat or bowl, recording 1/50 and 22, respectively.\n\nAshutosh Sharma (3/10): Ashutosh would be the individual to bore the brunt from Kohli's heroics the most. It was him who dropped the RCB legend when he was at zero. The India uncapped failed to do something with his batting as well.\n\nHarshal Patel (8/10): Bowled a dream last over, where he bagged three wickets and leaked only three runs. The wily pacer has now attained the Purple Cap as well.\n\nRahul Chahar (3/10): Chahar was understandably hit on a batting-friendly track. He leaked 47 runs in his three overs and lacked any sort of penetration.\n\nVidhwath Kaverappa (8/10): His debut IPL game could have been a something else if Ashutosh would have grabbed the chance of Virat Kohli.
